Micaela is from Tecpan.  She has two minor children and her economic activity is working manufacturing traditional textiles by hand; she also raises chickens.  She’s been doing this for years because it’s her only means of family support since her husband is of low economic resources.  Her husband works as a day laborer and his salary helps Micaela with the business.  Thanks to his support, she’s able to continue forward.  Her dream is to expand the business more in order to earn higher profits and to send her children to a better school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture traditrional textiles.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El solicitante el señor Daniel vive en el plan 3000 en su casa propia y en ella vive con sus hijas mayores de edad él no vive con su esposa por haberse separado de ella hace tiempo atrás él trabaja en una empresa como ensamblador de baterías para vehículos la cual esta ubicada en el parque industrial de santa cruz de la sierra pero como el sueldo es muy bajo en las empresas y no le ha alcanzado para termina de construir su casita  le falta muchas mejoras y has un cuarto que le falta acabado la necesidad de el préstamo es precisamente para mejorar esta condiciones tan precarias en las que vive y como no le es suficiente con su sueldo por que apenas le alcanza para poder vivir y transportarse al trabajo se ve en la necesidad de pedir el préstamo y si mejoraran poco su calidad de vida
texts.en: This applicant, Mr. Daniel, lives in the plan 3000 zone in his own home. He lives with his adult daughters, but does not live with his wife because they have been separated for a long time. He works assembling batteries for vehicles at a company located in the industrial park of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, but his salary is very low and he has not been able to finish construction on his home. His home is in need of many improvements, and has a room that needs to be finished. The loan is needed to improve the precarious conditions in which Daniel and his family live, because his income is barely enough to be able to live and transport himself to work. This need is why he is asking for the loan and hopes to improve his quality of life a little.

loans.use: to finish construction of a room for his home.

loans.name: Mabet Anamín

texts.es:
Mabet tiene 34 años de edad, es viuda su esposo murió cuando tenia seis meses de embarazo, hoy su hija tiene 16 meses de edad. Mabet vive junto a su madre y su hija. Desde hace un año, ella ejerce el oficio de cosmetóloga, lo aprendió en una academia especializada.  Posee dos locales que alquila en donde ha instalado sus salones de belleza, tiene dos empleadas. Los productos de belleza los compra por mayoreo, ya que tiene disponible para la venta y para aplicarlos ella en el salón. La ciudad en donde los compra esta a ocho kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más cantidad de perfúmenes, cosméticos, entre otros productos para el cabello. Con la inversión desea ampliar su negocio, para recibir mejores ingresos económicos que contribuyan a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y por supuesto para hacer que su negocio sea competitivo. Su mayor objetivo es trabajar para brindarle el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Mabet is 34 years old. She is a widow; her husband passed away when she was six months pregnant. Today her daughter is 16 months old. Mabet lives with her mother and her daughter. She has worked as a beautician for a year now, having studied in a specialized academy. She rents two locales where she has set up her beauty salons. She has two employees. She buys beauty products wholesale and both sells them and uses them in the salon. The city where she buys them is eight kilometres from her home.


The loan that she is requesting from Fundacíon Campo is to buy more perfumes, cosmetics and other hair products. With this investment she hopes to expand her business, to increase her income to help to meet the needs of her family and, of course, to make her business more competitive. Her larger goal is to work to provide her daughter with education.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of perfumes and cosmetics, including hair products.

loans.name: Jorge Anibal

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 57 años   es casado y tiene 2  hijos, no vive con su esposa  hace casi 5 años se separaron por problemas personales, vive en  casa de su mamá, su actividad principal es la de Chofer propietario de un Microbús el cual le costó mucho sacrificio comprarlo y tuvo que  restringirse de varios gastos por un tiempo largo para poder cubrir el monto del vehículo. hace casi  un año se enfermo  y gasto la mayor parte de sus ahorro en medicamentos y doctores, pero por suerte él se repuso de sus enfermedades y gastos médicos que tuvo pero ya no le alcanzó para  poder cubrir  los gastos del microbús, siendo el mismo el único ingreso mensual que tiene para mantenerse y mantener a sus dos hijos ya que él  les manda dinero mensualmente necesita el dinero para poder hacer  mantenimiento y reparación del mismo, para así poder seguir trabajando y  mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is 57 years old, married, and has two children. He has not lived with his wife for almost 5 years because they have separated due to personal problems. Jorge lives in his mother's house, and his primary work is as to drive his own microbus. It took a lot of sacrifice to purchase the microbus, and he had to restrict expenses for a long time to be able to cover the cost of the vehicle. For almost the entire past year, Jorge has been ill, and a large part of his savings has been spend on doctors and medicine. Luckily, he was able to recover from his illness and pay for his medical expenses, but he was not able to cover the expenses of the microbus. The microbus is the only source of income that he has to support himself and his two children, to whom he sends money every month. Jorge needs money to be able to maintain and repair the microbus, and in this way, to be able to continue working, increase his income, and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to repair his bus and continue working.

loans.name: Benjamin Miguel

texts.es: Don Benjamín es soltero no tiene hijos, es profesor de Ivirgarzama hace 4 años que trabaja en esta unidad educativa, vive sobre la carretera a puerto Villarroel donde cuenta con una pequeña parcela y trabaja junto a su familia, hace 3 años que se dedica a la avicultura cada año incrementa su producción de pollos parrilleros  este año ha incrementado un galpon de aproximadamente 450 m2. para una capacidad de 1500 pollos, don Benjamin es una persona responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, la comercialización la realiza de manera personal para tener mayores ingresos,  "porque si contrato gente no trabaja igual que uno" indica; no es integrante de  ninguna asociación, porque cuenta con un pequeño matadero rustico para el faeneo de los pollos y tiene un comprador fijo, como anteriormente indica que ha incrementado su producción ahora no cuenta con dinero para la próxima fase de producción, es por tal motivo que necesita dinero para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus pollos.
texts.en:
Benjamin is single and has no children. He is a teacher in Ivirgarzama and has worked in this teaching unit for four years now. He lives near the highway to Puerto Villarroel where he has a small plot of land, and works together with his family. For three years now he has earned a living poultry farming. Every year he increases his production of broiler chickens. This year he has added a shed that is approximately 450 square metres with a capacity for 1500 chickens. 

Benjamin is a responsible person who is dedicated to his work. He does the marketing personally in order to have a higher income, saying that "If I hire people, they do not work the same as oneself". He is not a member of any association because he has a small, rustic slaughterhouse to slaughter the chickens and he has a fixed buyer. As he mentioned earlier he has increased his production. Now he does not have the money for the next phase of production, for this reason he needs the money to buy animal feed for his chickens.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: El señor Sabino, tiene 56 años de edad, su unidad familiar está compuesta por de 4 miembros, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos por tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Sauces del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 25 años, produce cebolla, frejol y zanahoria para la alimentación de toda su familia y los excedentes los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. El señor Sabino, es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación de sus hijos. El señor Sabino, está solicitando el presente crédito, para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Sabino is 56 years old. His family is composed of 4 members, and is a humble family of few economic resources that farms on very small plots. Mr. Sabino lives in the community of Sauces in the municipality of Mizque, in the Cochabamba Department. He has worked in agriculture and livestock for 25 years, growing onions, beans, and carrots to feed his family and to sell the surplus in the marketplace of Mizque. Mr. Sabino is a very well-known person in his community, because of his dedication to his work and for being responsible for the education of his children. He is asking for this loan to purchase more seeds, manure, and agrochemicals to improve the quality and amount of his harvest, and in this way, to increase his income and improve living conditions for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Mercedes Irene

texts.es: Mercedes, tiene 55 años   es soltera ya que por cuidar a su mamá no tuvo  la oportunidad de casarse tiene una hija la cual ya es mayor también mamá soltera, pero por motivos económicos se fue a la Argentina así que dejo le dejó su hija a cargo. Mercedes se dedica a la fabricación de busos y poleras para lo cual tiene 4 maquinas de cocer con lo que trabaja en su domicilio hasta altas horas de la noche para poder entregar a tiempo sus pedidos, ella aprendió su oficio por que antes trabajaba  en una fabrica  de costura pero la despidieron  sin motivo alguno , se supone que tal vez fue por la edad, como la cliente tiene que mantener a su nieta  y se acerca fin de año donde recibe mas pedidos quiere invertir el dinero para comprar mas material para la fabricación de sus productos y  hacer mantenimiento de sus maquinas para así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old. She is single. She did not have the opportunity to marry because she was taking care of her mother. She has a daughter who is now an adult and who is also a single mother. Her daughter moved to Argentina for economic reasons and left her daughter in her care. Mercedes earns a living making jumpers and skirts. She has 4 sewing machines, working at home until the late hours of the night in order to deliver her orders on time. She learned her skill because she had previously worked as a seamstress in a factory but they fired her without any reason. She thinks it might have been because of her age. 

Because the client has to maintain her granddaughter and it is nearing the end of the year when she receives more orders, she wants to invest the money to buy more material to make her products and to perform maintenance on her machines in order to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material to make clothing.

loans.name: Erly Yaneth

texts.es:
Erly tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, su esposo es albañil. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ángulos de hierro y lamina; para elaborar las puertas y balcones de las ventanas de su casa. Ella lo que pretende es poseer una vivienda, digna, segura y cómoda para su familia. Su deseo, es proporcionar a sus hijos educación para que tengan un buen desarrollo.
texts.en:
Erly is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She devotes her time to the household chores while her husband works as a bricklayer.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy iron braces and lumber for making doors and window bars for her house. She intends to have a decent home that is secure and comfortable for her family. Her wish is to provide an education for her children so that they will develop well.

loans.use: to buy iron braces and lumber.

loans.name: Solange Stefania

texts.es: Solange tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos. Su madre comenzó su negocio de bazar y papelería, pero en el lapso del tiempo Solange se hizo cargo del negocio y como ve que está resultando  su negocio quiere invertir más para  que sus productos sean surtidos y  su clientela siga creciendo. Ella trabaja junto a su madre de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana hasta la 11 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara lápiz, cuadernos, regalos, peluches etc. Su meta es ampliar su bazar y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Solange is 22 years old, single, and has no children. Her mother started a business that consists of a bazaar and a stationery shop. As time passed, Solange took over the business and now wants to invest more so that she can add products to her inventory and grow her clientele. She and her mother work together Monday through Sunday from 7 A.M. to 11 P.M.

With this loan, Solange will buy pencils, notebooks, gifts, plush toys, and other products. Her goals are to expand the bazaar and to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy pencils, notebooks, gifts, plush toys, and other products.

loans.name: Dúo El Durasnal Group

texts.es:
DUO EL DURASNAL.
Doña Gregoria es originaria de la aldea Xetzac Tecpan, ella tiene 60 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura ella cultiva tomates, repollos, chiles y otras hortalizas ella cuenta con un pequeño invernadero donde realiza sus actividades y también se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace años doña Gregoria esta trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es el único medio que ella tiene parqa salir adelante.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue realizando sus actividades ya que el lo apoya con su trabajo y ayuda en el trabajo de la agricultura.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida, obtener mejores ganancias para un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Gregoria is originally from the village of Xetzac Tecpan. She is 60 years old and works in agriculture. She grows tomatoes, cabbages, chiles and other vegetables in her small greenhouse. She also raises animals. For years now, Gregoria has been working to help her family get ahead, and this is her only means to do so. Thanks to the support of her husband, she has continued with her work. He supports her work and helps with the agricultural work. Gregoria's dream is to grow her business in order to improve her quality of life and to obtain higher profits for a better future.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.es:
MARIA ENRIQUETA ella es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 51 años de edad tiene bajo su responsabilidad a un hijo menor de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos con telares y a la venta de ropa típica.
Desde hace años ella esta realizando los tejidos con telares ya que es el único medio que la ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia ya que ella empezó con un telar y gracias a Dios ahora ya cuenta con otros dos telares mas.
El esposo de ella trabaja en el mismo telar a ya que entre los dos se están apoyando para sacar a su hijo adelante, gracias al apoyo de el sigue trabajando para mejor mas el negocio.
El sueño de ella es comprar otros telares para obtener mejores ganancias  y mandar a su hijo a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
María Enriqueta is originally from Tecpan. She is 51 years old and has one minor son in her care. She is engaged in weaving and selling traditional clothing.

For years now, she has been weaving fabrics with a loom, as this is the only thing that has helped her to get her family ahead. She started with one loom and now, thanks to God, she has two additional looms.

María Enriqueta's husband works in the same weaving shop. Between the two of them, they are supporting their son. Thanks to her husband's support, María Enriqueta continues working to improve the business.

Her dreams are to buy additional looms in order to obtain better profits and to send her son to a better school, so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making traditional woven fabrics

loans.name: Israel Geovanny

texts.es: Israel tiene 25 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 1 hijo de 2 años. Su esposa tiene un salón de belleza en su casa. Israel trabaja fabricando  muñecos de papel eso es una tradicion en el Ecuador ya que para fin de año se los quema o tambien conocidos como monigotes. El empezó este trabajo hace 10 años atrás cuando su padre le enseño y fue entonces que él se independizo y en la actualidad fabrica monigotes de diferentes figuras comicas, politicos etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar: goma, pinturas, funda de papel etc. Su meta es enseñar a mucha gente este oficio
texts.en: Israel is 25 year old, married, and has a 2 year old son. His wife has a beauty salon located within their home. Israel makes paper figures for a living. In Ecuador, to celebrate the end of the year, these paper figure known as monigotes are burned. He started this job 10 years ago when his father taught him how to fabricate them. He eventually became independent and now makes all sorts of comic figures, politicians, etc. He will use the loan to buy: glue, paint, sheets of paper, etc. His goal is to expose his business to many people.

loans.use: buy glue, paint, sheets of paper, etc

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es:
Don Arnulfo es un señor emprendedor. el necesita de un prestamo de un millon de colones (1.000.000) para comprar materiales para construir un local para producir y vender abono organico liquido y microorganismos organicos.
esto le permitira poder mejorar su calidad de vida tanto economicamente como laboralmente, y asi surgir en el mercado nacional.
texts.en:
Arnulfo is an enterprising man.  He needs a loan for one million (1,000,000) colones to buy construction materials.  He will build a place to produce and sell liquid organic fertilizer and other organic microorganisms.  

This will allow him to be able to improve his quality of life financially and with his work.  This way he will emerge in the national market.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a place to sell organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan De Díos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos. Él es un hombre emprender desde hace 10 años aprendió por iniciativa propia a reparar bicicletas y posee un taller, también desde hace tres años instalo un tienda de productos básicos en su casa. Los productos para su tienda y para el taller de bicicletas los compra una vez por semana.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos para surtir su tienda y su taller de bicicletas. Con la inversión, busca que sus negocios estén bien establecidos para generar buenos ingresos que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor vida y dejar a sus hijos sus negocios para que tengan una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and he has 4 sons. He is an entrepreneurial man that 10 years ago learned to repair bicycles on his own initiative. He has a bicycle shop. Also 3 years ago he opened a store for general products in his home. The products for his store and bicycle shop are bought once a week.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase more products to supply his store and bicycle shop. With the investment, he is hoping to  establish his businesses well in order to produce a good income that will allow him to provide a better life to his family and so his sons can inherit the businesses so they can have a stream of income.

loans.use: to purchase more products to supply his store and his bicycle shop.

loans.name: Briam

texts.es: El joven Briam, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando para dar el examen de ingreso de la universidad pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, además de malas compañías que no le aconsejaron bien, vive junto a sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente. Actualmente vive en una pieza que le dieron sus padres en la zona de la Maica - Cochabamba. El cliente tiene como actividad principal el ingreso por trabajos en carpintería (mesas, sillas, roperos, escritorios, etc.), trabaja de lunes a sábado y también colabora por las tardes con la alimentación del ganado vacuno ya que la producción de leche es la actividad principal de la mama. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de herramientas de carpintería que le permitirán fabricar los diferentes muebles, además que en un futuro piensa ahorrar para abrir su propia carpintería.
texts.en:
Briam is a young man and is single. He has no partner, and has no children or dependents. He finished school and was studying for a university entrance exam. However he was not able to complete this part of his studies due to a lack of economic resources and the poor company he kept who advised him badly. He lives with his parents who decided that they would no longer support him financially, so that he would become more independent. At present he lives in a room that they have given him in the Maica area, in Cochabamba. 

His main source of income comes from carpentry (making tables, chairs, wardrobes, desks, etc.). He works from Monday to Saturday and he also helps his mother to feed her dairy cows in the evening time. This is her main work activity. He has requested the loan to buy carpentry tools which will enable him to make these different pieces of furniture. Moreover in the future he hopes to save money in order to open his own carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Dona Martha es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos a los que educa y ayuda con el trabajo que realiza a diario como sastre, estudio hasta cuarto básico, pero entro a un instituto donde aprendió a confeccionar prendar para cholitas, hace 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad tiene una caseta en el mercado 15 de abril donde abrió su pequeña tienda de ropa confeccionada ella es una persona responsable y dedicada a su trabajo y a sus hijos, el ser responsable con sus clientes hace que sea buscada para el confección de trajes, tiene ya clientes fijos, para incrementar sus ingresos económicos necesita comprar mas tela de costura y actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente para hacerlo, por este motivo el cliente quiere solicitar por segunda vez un crédito KIVA, así podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en: Martha is a single mother with two children who she is educating and who help with her daily work as a seamstress. She studied until the fourth grade, then entered an institute where she learned to make traditional Bolivian garments. She has been doing this work for seven years. She has a small stand in the 15th of April market, where she opened her small store of handmade clothing. Martha is a responsible person who is dedicated to her work and to her children. Because she is responsible with her customers, she is sought after for making suits and she has regular customers. In order to increase her income, Martha needs to buy more fabric and she does not currently have sufficient funds to do so. This is why she requesting a loan for the second time. This way, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric)

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIO DE LOS VALLES
JOSE LUIS TRABAJA DE PANADERO Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA. TIENE SEMBRADO MAIZ, FRIJOL, Y HACE POCO EMPEZO A SEMBRAR CHILE PIMIENTO Y CHILE PICANTE TIENE VARIOS TABLONES EN DONDE LAS PLANTAS YA ESTAN FLOREANDO, EL QUIERE SEMBRAR MAS HORTALIZAS Y SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, ABONO QUIMICO, ORGANICO Y FOLIARES, Y ASI SEGUIR CULTIVANDO ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CRÉDITO.
texts.en:
Dúo Lirio de los Valles

José Luis works as a baker and farms on the side.  He has planted corn and beans, and recently he began planting bell pepper and hot pepper.  He has various plots where the plants are already flowering.  He wants to plant more vegetables.  

He is applying for a loan to buy seeds and chemical, organic and foliar fertilizers so that he can continue farming.  He hopes that you can help him with the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical, organic and foliar fertilizers

loans.name: Dúo Los Aposentos Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Aposentos, Este Dúo esta conformado por la señora Alma Guadalupe, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace 4 años, le da gracias a Dios por habele dado la oportunidad de tener su negocito, desea seguir incrementando sus ventas por eso esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: Aposento Duo is a duo formed by Mrs. Alma Guadalupe. She has been selling local clothes for 4 years now. She thanks God for giving her the opportunity to have her small business. She wants to continue increasing sales which is why she is requesting a loan to buy necessary materials to fabricate local clothes.

loans.use: buy necessary materials to fabricate local clothes.

loans.name: Mercy Oliva

texts.es: Mercy tiene 57 años de edad es divorciada no tiene hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio de venta de víveres en general ya hace  15 años atrás decidió implementar su tienda de víveres en general al ver las necesidades  su barrio porque no había  ninguna tienda de víveres cerca de su casa. En la actualidad ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingo de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 e la noche. Con el préstamo  Mercy comprara arroz, aceite, azúcar, bebidas, carnes  etc. Su meta  a futuro es  poder tener un mini market para así poder incrementar sus clientes.
texts.en: Mercy is 57 years old, divorced, and does not have children. She started her grocery business 15 years ago. She decided to start her grocery store in order to meet the needs of her neighborhood, because there was no grocery store near her house. Currently, Mercy works alone from Monday to Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. With this loan, Mercy will buy oil, sugar, drinks, meat, etc. Her goal for the future is to own a "mini market" so that she can increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, drinks, meat, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Los Cipresales Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS CIPRESALES
ESTA INTEGRADO POR DOÑA FIDELIA, ELLAS SON ORIGINARIAS DEL MUNICIPIO DE SAN JUAN COMALAPA DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE CHIMALTENANGO, LAS DOS SON CASADAS DOÑA FIDELIA TIENE CUARENTA Y UN AÑOS DE EDAD Y ES MADRE DE DIEZ HIJOS ELLAS SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS EN TELAR  SU MAYOR PRODUCCION LA SACA EN LOS TELARES DE PEDAL PERO TAMBIEN REALIZAN TEJIDOS A MANO, ELLA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y PODER OBTENER MEJORES VENTAS POR EL FIN DE AÑO QUE YA SE ACERCA ENTONCES LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS TIPICOS.
texts.en:
The communal bank duo “Los Cipresales” includes Fidelia. The duo is from the municipality of San Juan Comalapa within the department of Chimaltenango. Both of them are married. Fidelia is forty-one years old and mother of ten children. She makes weavings by hand. She uses the pedal weaving machines for most of her production but she also weaves by hand.

She will use the loan to expand her business and increase her sales for the end of the year, which is coming up. She will buy materials to make traditional weavings.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional weavings.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda tries to be a good civilian. Her parent taught her on becoming independent because of their standard of living.  Imelda had a chance to enter college, but she did not finish her education because of a financial shortage. She works quickly and financially supports her sister in her education. 

At the age of 27, Imelda got married. She is lucky to be married to a farmer and blessed with three children as fruit of their love. Her children are attending school, but her oldest child, who is in the third year of college, had to stop temporariiy because of financial difficulty. 

Imelda engages in a business selling vegetables. She plants and harvests vegetables and sells them in the market. She strives to earn a profit and will continue sends her children in school. 

Imelda wanted to expand her area of planted vegetables to earn higher income, but she doesn’t have enough money to proceed. In this connection, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant. She hopes to help her children finish their education and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Josecito De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Josecito de Cumbe está conformado por 10 socias quienes son amigas y vecinas de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de bellos paisajes, tiene un clima frió y su centro parroquial es una mezcla de la arquitectura antigua con la moderna. Sus habitantes como nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles que siempre buscan la manera de sacar adelante a sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades como es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio, muchos trabajan en la ciudad o han emigrado para buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo con el mismo fin de mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Blanca, tiene 58 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 12 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión sastre, la casa en la que vive es de propiedad conyugal.

Doña Blanca hace 8 años se dedica a la atención de una tienda que es de su propiedad, trabaja en ella de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, como pasa en casa en su negocio le da el tiempo necesario para cuidar de su familia y también criar animales como cuyes y gallinas.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda.
 
Su meta es de ampliar su tienda y también realizar un galpón de pollos más grande para crecer en la cría de estos animales.
texts.en:
The Josecito de Cumbe communal bank is comprised of ten members.  They are friends and neighbors from the Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by beautiful scenery, and its climate is cold.  The parish center is a mix of ancient and modern architecture.  Its residents, like our members, are nice, kind people.  They are looking for the way to get their families ahead.  They work in different business activities like agriculture, raising animals, and commerce.  Many work in the city or have emigrated in order to look for better work opportunities.  They do this in order to financially improve their households.

Blanca, age 58, is one of the members of this group.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has a 12 year old son who goes to a school in the city.  Her husband is a tailor, and the house they live in is their own.

Blanca has been tending to her own store for eight years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.  As her business is in her house, she has the time she needs to take care of her family.  She also raises animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

She will use the loan to buy provisions for her store.  Her goal is to expand her store and to make a bigger chicken coop in order to raise more of these animals.

loans.use: to buy food for her store.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 55 years old. She is a patient mother of five, now all grown up. She always believes in this statement: "Don't allow life dependent on others if you still can."

Though her children all have their own families now, having their good sources of income, Tessie manages a retail store to support her daily living. Using an initial capital of PHP1,000 in the store, Tessie made it to PHP10,000 in revolving capital now after 10 years of managing her store. 

Before, Tessie with her husband bought and sold harvested corn crops,  Due to her husband's death, the business broke down. This time, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 as added capital for her retail store. She will use it to buy sacks of rice to retail as an added store offering.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to retail as an added store offering.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, 59, is a mother of four children of adult ages. To supplement her husband's income from farming, she manages a retail store and a mini-eatery in their village. She is rolling an estimated amount of PHP 20,000 into the business at the moment. After 15 years of doing the retailing business, Nelia now earns PHP 8,000 each month, which has been used to support members of her extended family. 

Her plan to pursue peanut butter making as an additional product to offering in her store encourages Nelia to request additional capital from ASKI. She is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy peanuts and groceries like seasonings, canned goods and more stocks to display in her store. Nelia learned this peanut butter making skill from her expert friend.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, and groceries like seasoings, canned goods and more.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios has managed a piggery business for 20 years now. She has one breeder pig and four fatteners. Aside from this, she also buys and sells frozen foods like pork sausages, hot dogs, tocino (sweetened cured pork, similar to bacon), etc. once a week. She earns PHP 4,000 each month from her food selling. That was used in the expansion of her businesses. 

She is now 55 years old, married to a farmer and a patient mother of four adult age children. She and her family peacefully live in the village of Reina Mercedes in Isabela Province. 

She is requesting to avail the amount of PHP 10,000. That will be helpful in her piggery and frozen foods selling. She will buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for the piggery and the amount left will be spent as added capital in her food-selling business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for her livestock maintenance.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a hardworking father and husband.  He is from the village of Namilangan Alfonso Lista.  According to him, the primary source of income of the families from the village comes from farming of corn crops.  At this time, he manages both his corn farm and livestock business.

Rolly is married with seven children.  Four of his children are studying, while the other three are already married.  He is thankful because his wife is supportive in the growth of their farm and livestock business.  At this time, Rolly is busy preparing his corn field, so his wife will temporarily replace her husband's role in taking care of his hogs to maintain their proper growth, though he is busy cultivating his farm land.

Rolly would like to ask for a loan of PHP 27,000, allowing him to buy stocks of hog feed and necessary vitamins needed in the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes to obtain this loan amount so he can make his hogs healthier in reaching their optimum growth. In this way, he can deal his hogs for a higher price, which will enable him to send his children to a higher level of education and give his family a comfortable living condition.

loans.use: to buy stocks of hog feed and necessary vitamins for proper growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Vicmar

texts.en:
Vicmar admits that his career path means a lot of hard work and patience. He is 32 years old and a single man. He is the youngest among his three siblings, so he lives with his parents. 

Vicmar plants rice on his two hectares of farm land. Since it's planting season, he makes sure that his farm plot is well prepared with complete essential nutrients enabling him to obtain a plentiful harvest this next crop season. Vicmar struggles from insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to prepare his two hectares of rice fields, and for buying farm supplies. He knows that through this loan he could further improve his financial stability and have a comfortable living condition.

loans.use: to prepare his land and to buy farm supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Nueva Generación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Nueva Generación está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene paisajes mágicos ya que encantan o enamoran a quienes la visitan, es una mezcla de lo colonia y lo moderno, su gastronomía es muy variada. Nuestras socias tienen un gran carisma el mismo que les caracteriza, se dedican a varias actividades las que les permiten ser independientes económicamente y a su vez ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, trabajan diariamente sin descanso para salir adelante, su orgullo es de aun mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Matilde, está realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Nueva Generación, vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 10 años, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios ya que es policía, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Rosa Matilde pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo realizando los quehaceres de su hogar pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, esta actividad la realiza en sus tiempos libres o cuando tiene la oportunidad de ofrecer sus productos a sus amigas y conocidas, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años.

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de oferta para ofrecer a su exigente clientela.
 
Su sueño es tener una casita propia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Generación communal bank is comprised of nine women and one man who live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  This city has magical scenery, and the people who see it are enchanted or fall in love with it.  It is a mix of the colonial and the modern.  Its food is varied.  Our members are known for their great charisma.  They work at various business activities, which allow them to be financially independent and to help their households financially.  They work every day without rest in order to get ahead.  They are proud of still maintaining the culture and traditions of their villages.

Rosa Matilde is one of the members of this group.  This is her first loan with the Nueva Generación communal bank.  She lives in the Yanuncay area of the city of Cuenca.  She is 34 years old, married, and has three children, ages 17, 15, and 10.  Her oldest two daughters go to secondary school, and her youngest child goes to a primary school in the city.  Her husband works as a policeman.  They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live.

Rosa Matilde spends most of her time doing the household chores.  However, in order to contribute financially to her household, she sells different brands of cosmetics.  She does this in her free time or when she has the opportunity to offer her products to her friends and acquaintances.  She has been doing this business activity for five years.

She will use her loan to buy cosmetics that are on special promotion in order to offer them to her discerning clientele.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Anne is requesting to borrow PHP 10,000 as additional capital in her food stall business. This will be used to buy raw ingredients like seasonings, vegetables and meat that she will prepare and cook before offering to her customers. She will also buy some noodles and other food snacks to sell. 

The business is already seven years running. It is situated in a school and operates from Monday to Friday. Mary Anne is earning PHP 4,000 each month in her business. 

She uses her earnings to support the educational needs of her children, and some little amount is saved as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food stall like seasonings, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a hardworking mother who runs a small eatery in her community. She is 48 years old and has six school-age children.  

She is the only one who provides for the needs of her children, for she is separated from her husband due to problems and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift their status of living and educate all her children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to cover their necessities and support the education of her children. 

In this regard, she plans to improve and strengthen the business to generate a higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soaps, junk foods, beverages and seasonings for sale. 

She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business and hopes that someday she will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soaps, junk foods, beverages and seasonings for sale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena married at an early age. She is 21 years old and has two children. One child attends school, and the other is still young. She works as an assistant for a lumber company in Cauayan, and her husband works as a salesman at the same company. Combining their salaries, the couple earns 4,000 PHP net income monthly to support their daily needs, especially the needs of their children. 

Lorena is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that she will use to open a general store. Her mother will look after this business while she continues working daily at the lumber company with her husband. The loan will also be used to buy merchandise for the store including canned and bottled goods, seasonings, coffee, sugar, shampoo, and soap.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned and bottled goods, seasonings, coffee, sugar, shampoo, and soap

loans.name: Betty Jane

texts.en:
After getting married, Betty Jane began a vegetable-vending business. Her husband assists her in managing this business. She plants vegetables in their field to harvest and sell at the market. She has been in this type of business for 21 years. Managing her business has improved her communication abilities. Through her vending business, Betty Jane is able to send her three children to school. They are in college and high school. 

Betty Jane is seeking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables and insecticides to apply to her planted vegetables in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and insecticides to apply to her planted vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 and married with two adult age children. Josephine shares her experiences from abroad. She has six years' experience abroad working as a domestic helper. Whenever her relatives called her for remittance, she gave without hesitation. When she came home. she noticed that she had not enough earnings to start her plan. She planned a business that needed little capital but seemed to generate enough income.

Josephine came to a decision that she would engage herself in the meat processing business. Two years later, she still manages the business. She is enjoying making embutido and longganisa, which are made from pork meat. After making the products, she makes the rounds in their village and sells it. 

Josephine wants to expand the products she sells, and she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy meat and spices for meat processing. She hopes to improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy meat and spices for meat processing.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a married woman doing her best to supplement her husband's income for the growing needs of their family. She is 25 years old with two children. Prior to her employment in a certain fast food/bakeshop, she manages a retail store. This business still exists, and her mother-in-law looks after it and her children. Vanessa's husband works in a rural bank too in their town.

Vanessa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods and soda for the retail store. She will also use the loan to purchase house materials such as nails and galvanized iron for the initial construction of their own simple house.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods and soda, as well as some house materials such as nails and galvanized iron

loans.name: Florfina

texts.en:
Florfina is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer, and she runs a hog-raising business in the village. Through their farming and livestock businesses, Florfina and her husband are able to send their children to school. She is proud to share that her oldest child already holds a degree and is looking for employment.

Florfina wishes to have good health so that she can continue managing her business. Presently, Florfina is facing financial shortages because she prioritizes her children's needs in school. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. This will improve her business, allowing her to better provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is now 46 years old. He a responsible father of three. His family lives in the poor village of Baringin Norte.  

Edgardo is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 as added capital in his butcher shop business. More than a year in his operation in the business, he has calculated PHP 4,000 as his monthly income from it. He used to butcher a pig once a week and sell its meat around his village. 

The income being generated from the business went towards the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy pigs for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.They currently reside in a rural community where most of the inhabitants are farmers who bring a majority of their products to town to sell. 

Because Gladys and her husband own a truck, they are often hired by the farmers to bring their products to town. They need to repair and replace damaged parts of the truck to ensure safe transportation. Due to financial difficulty, Gladys is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy gasoline, tires, and tools needed for the maintenance of their truck.

Gladys believes that this loan will enable them to repair their truck and continue using it to gain income. They are hoping that they will become financially stable and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, tires, and tools needed for the maintenance of their truck

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is requesting the amount of PHP 7,000 as added capital in her rolling business. She will use the loan to buy various vegetables, fruits and meats to sell around their village. She has been in the business for four years already, and she is earning PHP 6,000 net income from her business each month. 

Aside from selling fruits and vegetables door-to-door, she also operates barbecue-selling in the late afternoon in the village hall, since potential customers are there. 

She is already 29 years old. Two of her children already attend school and the other two are still young. Her husband, on the other hand, is a construction worker earning PHP 250 daily. The couple works together to save for the future education of their children and unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables, fruits and meats to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are both studying at the college level, the eldest in the fourth year and her youngest in the third year. Her eldest child had to leave school due to financial difficulties, and Edna dreams of being able to send this child back to college.

Edna manages a livestock business in the village, while her husband's source of income is farming. According to her, she gains a profit after four months, when she sells the hogs. Edna wants to buy piglets so that, after selling the hogs, she still has remaining pigs to raise. 

Edna is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. She hopes to raise healthy piglets, earning income that will make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Aziza, who is in her early 30s, is married and living together with her husband and has two children who are in school.  For three years now, Aziza has earned a living by running a genge business selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal. She works in her business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase more on the business inventory and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is requesting a loan to increase on the genge stock to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business widely in Tanzania.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Karafuu," which totals 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the genge stock to resell.

loans.name: Tiro Group

texts.en:
Malidhia, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a cafe business selling food, juices, water, maandazi, vitumbua and chapati for two years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the business stocks and opened a place for the business. (Previously, she used to sell as a vendor without premises, but now she has rented a room.)   She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to start selling new clothes door to door. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel and to send her children to good schools. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tiro," which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. (Two of the clients were laughing, so their faces can not be seen clearly, but at least 13 clients can be seen.)

loans.use: to start selling new clothes door to door.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as added capital for her retailing business. She will buy raw ingredients like sugar, bananas, noodles, coconut and glutinous rice for additional food snacks to sell. In her current business, Crispina is earning PHP 4,000 net income each month, and this has gone towards the expansion of her newly opened retailing business. 

She is now 42 years old, married and a mother of three. One of her children is still in college. She once became an OFW in Kuwait for six years, and now stays in the Philippines to manage her newly opened store well. 

Her hope is to see her business grow with help of the money she is borrowing.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like sugar, bananas, noodles, coconut, and glutinous rice for additional food snacks to sell.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn believes that having patience and making sacrifices will bear good fruit someday. A 43-year-old mother of five, she and her husband aim to become financially stable so that they will be able to support their children's education and give them a bright future. To this end, Genelyn earns income through a hog-raising business to generate income and support her husband in financing their education. While they sometimes experience hardships and difficulties in life, they have a strong determination to improve their standard of living.

Genelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that she will improve the business and make it viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children who go to school. He has run a grocery and a welding business for four years.  He works on welding from 7:00 a.m. TO 5:00 p.m. daily and employs a man in his grocery business. Said is able to generate a good monthly profit. 

This will be Said's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used previous loans to buy a plot of land on which to build a house; to buy welding machines; and to cover household expenses and school fees. Said has successfully paid back all of his loans. 

Said now hopes for a loan to increase his grocery inventory. His dream is to one day be able to own a hardware business. He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mbayuwayu Group," which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: increase his grocery inventory.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is now 30 years old. She is married and the mother of three children (one attends school, and two are younger). Her husband operates an installment motorcycle used in transport business daily around Cauayan City. They earned PHP 3,000 in the transport business, and it went towards the amortization of their motorcycle. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She will buy general merchandise like canned goods, bottled, candies, seasonings, and more to start up a small store using this loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like canned goods, bottled, candies, seasonings, and more to start up a small store.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 52 years old and has four children. Her youngest currently attends college. To support her child's education, Leticia manages a business selling snacks in the morning door-to-door around their village in Marabulig II. She also used to sell barbecue in front of their house. In addition to these, she also has a hog-raising business, in which some of her 10,000 PHP monthly income is used to maintain the livestock.

To further provide sufficient support to her business capital, especially her livestock raising, Leticia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients needed in her snack-selling business, including sugar, coconut, and banana. She will also use the loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed in her food business, such as sugar, coconut, and banana, as well as feed for her pigs

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for advance purchases for her AVON direct selling business, allowing her to increase her credit line with AVON. She will also use the loan to pay for the monthly installment of her acquired motorcycle for transportation. 

Thelma and her husband also work daily at an eatery beside Cauayan Medical Specialist Hospital, where they are paid a total of 6,000 PHP each month combined. The earnings from their salaries went to savings for the building of their simple house.

loans.use: to pay for advance purchases in her AVON business

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Zuena, who is in her early 30's, is married and has two children who attend school. She has been selling cosmetics for three years. She works from 10am to 6pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more cosmetics, a television, and radios, as well as to pay school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all her of loans successfully. Zuena is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to re-sell, as well as to start selling fabrics. Her dream is to open a large clothing and cosmetics shop.

Zuena will share this loan with her loan group "Ufunuo," which totals fourteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to re-sell, and to start selling fabrics

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard working mother who runs a small variety store in her village. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Being responsible parents, Gina and her husband are striving to improve their living conditions in order to continue sending their children to school. They hope that their children will earn degrees and find good jobs in the future. 

Despite their hardships, they have the determination to achieve their goals. Gina seeks to improve her small variety store in order to generate sufficient income for her family. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stocks of breads, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, fruits, and vegetables to sell in her store. 

Through hard work and perseverance, she believes that they will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of breads, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hog raiser from Padul who lives with her husband and two children. She is 25 years old. Her spouse is a farmer. They both generate income to sustain the family's needs for meals and school fees.

She would like to improve the growth of her hogs and sustain them with enough feed, vaccines and medicines, which she will buy out of the loan of PHP 6,000 she is requesting. 

Good nutrition for her hogs will lead to higher sales prices and improved income as well.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 49 years old, is a mother of four children. Two among them are still studying. She is already a widow for 19 years, and since then she solely manages her business to support her children's education. She and her children happily live in the village of Gappal, a poor but peaceful place to live in. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 that she will use to buy farm inputs and hog feed for her hog-raising maintenance. 

Originally, she was a rolling vendor in their village to earn a daily income. She rolls meat, fish, vegetables and "balut" (boiled fertilized egg) around their village. The operation of this business is quite good; she is earning PHP 4,000 net income each month that was used to provide for the school tuition fees and school allowances of her children. 

Marilou is hoping somehow to put up her permanent store in their house, for she is tired from her rolling business activity. She will just display her rolled products in the store, if given an opportunity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hog feed for her hog-raising maintenance.

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Kea, who is in his early 40s, is married and lives with his wife and baby. He has been running a business selling phone equipment for one year now.  He works from 9 am to 6 pm daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

He is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open the place of business, to take phone equipment to an auction to resell, and to cover household expenses. He has repaid all of his loans successfully. He wants a new loan to add more phone equipment, such as batteries and housing, to resell. His dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land on which he expects to build his family a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Rufiji," which totals 25 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to add more phone equipment, such as batteries and housing, to resell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a patient businesswoman, with seven years of experience. She maintains a general store with working capital of PHP 50,000. She earns a maximum income of PHP 20,000 monthly in the business, which is used for the maintenance of her hog-raising business and also goes toward the allowances for her child in school.

Analiza is 40 years old, married, and has three children. One is still studying, and the other two are older. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of goods for the store, such as coffee, sugar, seasonings, soda, breads, candies, soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, noodles and many more. 

This loan will be her second loan cycle. Her first loan was for PHP 5,000 and was used as additional working capital in the store.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods for her store, such as coffee, sugar, seasonings, soda, breads, candies, soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, noodles and many more.

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
David, who is in his early 20s, is single and still young. He has been running a pharmacy (medicine shop) for two years now. He is also studying medical issues.  He works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to pay school fees for himself, cover his household expenses, and buy more medicines. He has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to purchase more medicines for his business. His dream is to one day be able to have more skills in medical issues. 

He will share this loan with his loan group " PERA ", which includes 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 52 years old, married and has six chidlren. Five of her children are attending school. She is raising hogs to sell and her spouse is a rice farmer. When selling the grown hogs, she usually gains PHP 3,000 for each hog. She uses her income to pay school fees.  Mercedes would like to increase her income by raising and selling healthy hogs. 

Mercedes would like to buy feed and medicines for the hogs but has insufficient funds now. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to sustain hogs. 

In the future, Mercedes would like to achieve stable income for her children's education and the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for the hogs

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is fifty-eight years old, the mother of three children, and a widow.  She sells beads to her customers in the community. All the children are grown and take care of themselves.
 
She has been in business for the past twenty years, and is still doing very well, thanks to ID Ghana, which trained her on how to talk to customers and how to keep her business running in the right direction.

She chose this business because it has been a sort of family business that she learned from her mother, as she was growing to adulthood. She buys beads in the market at wholesale prices and sells at retail prices. She has displays of some of her bead products in the photograph.

She joined ID Ghana in 2010 and, to her amazement, has taken five cycles of loans. She is requesting an amount of 1,000 Ghana cedis to expand her business and buy more goods to sell to her customers. In her fourth cycle, she received 850 cedis, which was used for the same purpose. She makes enough to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy more beads to sell to customers.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old. She has three adult children. Her husband is a farmer. They live in the peaceful village of Gappal. She sells fish in their village to supplement her husband’s income from farming. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy bigger quantities of fish and meat, so that her income will increase. Her monthly earned income, which is PHP 6,000, is used to expand her business and to maintain her other business, raising livestock. Sometimes, she also extends financial support for the studies of their grandchildren, when she has some extra income.

loans.use: to buy fish and meat to sell in her village.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children, who are in school. Since 2007, Magreth has been earning a living by running two businesses, a restaurant and a business selling genge (fruits and vegetables).  She works from 6am to 3pm daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

She has requested a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy restaurant food items (such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and 25kg of rice) and to pay school fees, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her stock of genge. Her dream, one day, is to be able to provide a better education for her children.

She will share this loan with her loan group, " Imani," which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of genge (fruits and vegetables) to sell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
For almost six years in the retailing business, Remy has been able to earn PHP 15,000 average net income each month from her general store operation and her travelling sales business where she sells sells meat, fish and vegetables around their village. This income goes towards the education of her children. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional capital for her business. She will buy grocery items like soda, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, meat, fish, vegetables and many more. If given another loan, it will be her second loan. 

Remy is 44 years old. Her husband drives the motorcycle she uses to travel to sell her food products. They are blessed with four children. One already finished school and three of them are still studying.

loans.use: To buy grocery items like soda, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, meat, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a hog grower from Padul. She is 28 years old and has six children. She has been raising hogs to sell for income. She usually gains PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. She would like to improve her sales so she is asking for PHP 6,000 to buy another piglet and its feed for sustainability. It will help nourish her hogs and be able to raise them healthier.

Someday, she hopes to keep making her business profitable and earn funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and feed

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is a 44 year old trader who sells foodstuffs (yams, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc.) in the Teshie market. She is married to Richard, 54, who is unemployed, and she has three children in school. 

Alena’s life is not so easy, but things have stabilized a lot for her family since she joined ID Ghana. With 17 years of experience in her business, she has been able to secure her place in the market and is doing very well. 

She travels to the central region and its environs for her cassava, plantain and yam on a monthly basis, which she then sells and supplies to chop bar (slang for food bar) owners.

On her fourth loan, she requested an amount of 800 Ghana cedis, so that she could buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers and thus expand the business. She received 500 Ghana cedis in her third loan cycle, which she completed on 8/9/2012. 

She has been reinvesting the profits she made with her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lourdes Del Pilar

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 59 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos el mayor de sus hijos tiene 7 años el segundo tiene 5 años y el ultimo tiene 3 años. Ella comenzó a hace 5 años atrás vendiendo con su hermano artículos para el hogar al ver que el negocio resulto ella se independizo vendiendo sus productos. En la actualidad Lourdes trabaja recorriendo diferentes sectores de la ciudad de Guayaquil ofertando sus productos entre amigo y vecinos con la facilidad que deja sus productos a crédito. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más artículos de hogar como ollas reposteros, vajillas, vasos  etc. Su sueño es tener su casa completamente de cemento para que su hijos se sientan contentos
texts.en: Lourdes is 59 years old, married, and has three children who are 7, 5, and 3 years old. She began selling home products with her brother five years ago. As a result, she became independent selling her products. Now Lourdes works through different sectors in the city of Guayaquil offering her products between friends and neighbors with the ease of a loan. With this loan, she wants to buy more home products like slow cookers, dishes, glasses, etc. Her dream is to have her house made completely of cement so that her children feel good.

loans.use: to buy home products such as slow cookers, dishes, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Broom Group

texts.en:
Broom group consist of two partners and has been in existence for the pass twelve years. 

Alfred was born in Teshie, and he is 35 years old. This is his second loan from ID Ghana. He works in order to take care of the household expenses. He is married to Felicia, who is 34 years old and a trader. They have two children. 
 
He is hardworking, industrious and circumspect in all his dealings, which lead to his business booming. He sells soft drinks. He has been doing this business for nine years, and it is going well. His earnings are getting better, so he buys more inventory to meet his customers' demand. 

Alfred and Dora, together, need to borrow a total of 800 Ghanaian cedis to buy more goods to resell to their customers, thus expanding their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more goods to resell to customers.

loans.name: Dúo San Jose De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
San José de san Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por Hilda, ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, churrascos, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su venta de churrascos que se dedica a vender de lunes a viernes  y para compra de maíz para su venta de tortillas, ya que los días sábados lo utiliza para estudiar  enfermería su propósito es seguir la universidad y prepararse más en la vida para seguir apoyando a su mama quien quedo viuda hace seis años, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hermanitos desidio comenzar con su negocio,espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
This duo, belonging to the San José de san Bartolo group, includes 27-year-old Hilda. Hilda is single and has a business selling tortillas and grilled meat .
She has applied for this loan to invest in her business. 

Hilda works Monday through Friday, and spends Saturdays studying nursing. Her purpose is to finish university, to be able to prepare herself for life and continue to support her mother who was widowed six years ago. In order to support her siblings she started her business, and hopes to be able to help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to invest in meat for her stall and corn to prepare her tortillas, which she sells from Monday to Friday

loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart purchased his motorcycle with the previous loan, and he is very thankful to lenders for this. All these past months, the profit generated from the sale of dairy has increased with the use of the new motorcycle. Taking dairy and other products to the local market has now became easier for him.

With this new loan, he is looking to purchase inventory items for his small grocery store.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for his small grocery store in his village

loans.name: Valeria Viviana

texts.es: Valeria viven el sur de Guayaquil en una zona llamada isla trinitaria, es soltera tampoco tiene hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogos gracias a su  tía quien vende productos cosméticos y un día le dijo que la ayudara a vender y eso a ella le gusto mucho. En la actualidad Valeria se independizo con la venta de cosméticos por catálogos. La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos.  Valeria por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar, artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc.
texts.en:
Valeria lives in the south of Guayaquil in an area called Isla Trinitaria.  She is single and has no children.  She started her business of selling cosmetics by catalog thanks to her aunt who sells cosmetic products and one day she told Valeria to help her sell them and she liked that very much.  

At present Valeria has become independent with the sale of cosmetics by catalog.  The way that she works is to go around to various places in the city offering the products among friends and acquaintances.  Valeria, for the time being, has not had any problem with regard to delinquency and hopes to be able to continue in this manner.  

With the loan she plans to buy beauty items like lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.use: to buy beauty items like lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Leonela Tamara

texts.es: Leonela tiene 27 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos el mayor tiene  5 años y el menor  tiene 3 años de edad, el mayor asiste a una escuela cerca de su casa. Ella comenzó un negocio de carnicería hace 6 años atrás pero al pasar del tiempo la expandió a lo que es ahora una tienda de víveres en general. En la actualidad ella trabaja en su tienda sola de lunes a domingo desde las  6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo comprara víveres en general como arroz, enlatados, azúcar, lácteos etc. Su meta es ampliar su negocio para así ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela y arreglar su casa.
texts.en: Leonela is 27 years old and married. She has 2 children; the older one is 5 years old and the younger one is 3. The older one attends a school near her home. She started a business selling meat 6 years ago, but over time she expanded it, and now it is a shop selling general groceries. Currently, she works alone in her store from Monday through Sunday, from 6 in the morning until 9 in the evening. With the loan, she will buy general groceries such as rice, canned foods, sugar, dairy products, etc. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can offer a better service to her customers and be able to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general such as rice, canned foods, sugar, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Mari Cruz

texts.es:
MARI CRUZ

DOÑA MARI CRUZ EN UNA SOCIA YA CONOCIDA EN FAPE POR SU RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD DE PAGO, ELLA TIENE UN RESTAURANTE Y TORTILLERIA, EN SU RESTAURANTE LE ENCARGAN PEDIDOS POR MAYOR SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAIZ CRIOLLO, LEÑA Y ARTICULOS PARA SU RESTAURANTE. SU SUEÑO ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE ASI TAMBIEN ELLA PUEDA ESTAR BIEN Y ASI BRINDARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: Mari Cruz is well known in FAPE because of her responsible attitude and her punctuality in making payments. She has a restaurant and tortilla business. She takes wholesale orders at her restaurant. She is requesting this loan to buy the local variety of corn, firewood and items for her restaurant. Her dream is to continue growing her business in order to have a good life and to be able to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy the local variety of corn, firewood and items for her restaurant

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa tiene 61 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos ya que son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Ella  empezó a emprender un propio negocio ya hace muchos años atrás  la cual es la venta de fritada, con la ayuda de sus hijos ella se pudo comprar su carreta para ahí vender la fritadas y hasta el día de hoy es su sustento de vida. En la actualidad ella trabaja sola vendiendo sus fritadas en la esquina de su casa de lunes  domingo desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, bebidas, mote, etc. Su meta es llegar a tener un restaurante muy reconocido por tener las mejores comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en: Rosa is 61 years old, divorced, and has three children who are independent adults.  She started her own business many years ago.  She sells fried foods.  With the help of her children, she was able to purchase a cart to sell her fried foods.  Even today, this is her livelihood.  Currently she works selling her food on the corner by her house from Monday to Sunday from 2pm until 9pm.  She will use this loan to purchase meat, drinks, corn, and other items.  Her goal is to have a restaurant that is known for typical Ecuadorean foods.

loans.use: to purchase meats, drinks, corn, and other items.

loans.name: Nexi Idalia

texts.es:
Nexi tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella lleva cinco años de administrar su propia tienda y tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la sastrería. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar, fríjol, maíz, arroz y maicillo, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ganancias, ya que actualmente no posee esos productos para venderlos en su tienda y no quiere perder clientes por no disponer de estos productos.
texts.en:
Nexi is 26 years old and married with two children. She has been running her own store for 5 years now, and for over 20 years has worked as a seamstress as well. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy beans, corn, rice and other grains, in order to improve her earnings in the store. She currently does not have these products to sell in her store, and she doesn't want to lose clients as a result of not having them.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice and grains

loans.name: Orlin Stalin

texts.es: Orlin vive en el sur de la ciudad de Guayaquil conocido como La Isla Trinitaria, es divorciado y  tiene 2 hijos. El comenzó vendiendo artículos para el hogar también cosas plásticas pero al pasar del tiempo ahorro dinero y se como una motocicleta. En la actualidad el hace fletes en un motocicleta transforma en tricimoto. El trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprara repuesto para su moto y artículos del hogar para retomar el negocio anterior etc. Su meta es tener un comercial grande de venta de artículos para hogar
texts.en: Orlin lives in the south of the city of Guayaquil known as La Isla Trinitaria.  He is divorced and has two children.
