He started selling household goods and plastic items, but saved his money over time to purchase a motorcycle.  Now he takes fares in a motorcycle that has been made into a tricimoto (a motorcycle with a cart attached for passengers).  He works from Monday to Sunday from 7am until 6pm.  He will use this loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and household goods so that he can restart his previous business.  His goal is to have a large store to sell household goods.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and housewares.

loans.name: Esmeraldeñas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Esmeraldeñas es un banco comunal que está formado por 6 socias y 3 socios quienes son amigos y conocidos, son oriundos de la provincia verde como se le conoce a Esmeraldas, todos han llegado a la ciudad de Cuenca para mejorar sus ingresos y por un mejor futuro para sus familias, viven los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, son personas trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para mejorar su estabilidad económica, son personas de un gran carisma que mantienen viva sus costumbres y traiciones.

La Señora. Erika es una mujer muy carismática y alegre que forma parte del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas y está realizando el segundo crédito en este banco comunal. Tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido dos hijos, su primer hijo de 9 años que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad y su segundo hijo de apenas 9 meses de nacido. Su esposo se dedica al comercio de mariscos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Erika desde hace 6 años tiene un puesto en donde vende todo tipo de mariscos y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo, esta actividad le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mariscos para continuar creciendo en este negocio.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto el señor coordinador de la fundación, está parado en la última fila con una camiseta amarilla.
texts.en:
Esmeraldeñas is a communal bank group formed by 6 women and 3 men, all friends and acquaintances, from the "green province" as Esmeraldas is known. All of them have come to the city of Cuenca to improve their income and improve the futures of their families. They live on the outskirts of the city and are all very hardworking people, always fighting for greater economic stability. They are very charismatic people who maintain their customs and traditions. 

Erika is a very charismatic and happy woman who is part of this communal bank, and she is in her second loan cycle. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children - a 9 year old who studies in a school in the city, and a 9 month old baby. Her husband works in the shellfish business, and they rent their home as they do not own one. 

For the past 6 years Erika has had a market stall where she sells all types of shellfish, and she works Sunday through Saturday, without a fixed schedule. This business allows her to make enough money to maintain her home. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of shellfish in order to continue growing her business. 

Her dream is to one day own her own home. 

In this photo, the loan coordinator from the microfinance institution (Fundacion ESPOIR) can be seen in the yellow shirt, standing in the last row.

loans.use: to buy shellfish

loans.name: Villistas Group

texts.es: Villistas es un grupo solidario de 8 personas trabajadoras, son amigas y se ayudan entre sí para salir adelante con su crédito. La señora Nora es una mujer buena que siempre a luchado por el bienestar de sus hijos, tiene 51 años y es casada, tiene 5 hijos. Nora se dedica a la venta de elotes, tamales y otras comidas. Ella decidió comenzar con su negocio, ya que en un tiempo tuvo un hijo muy enfermo y se propuso a sacarlo adelante. Ya tiene 6 años trabajando y el crédito la ayudara a comprar unas vaporeras, ya que las que tiene son muy viejas y están quemadas y también comprara mas elotes, carbón, hojas  y masa para preparar tamales y demás cosas. Un sueño que Nora desea cumplir es tener su propia fonda y tener muchos clientes. Este grupo es especial y sus integrantes son personas sobresalientes que piensan es el bienestar de sus familias, ellas desean ser el mejor grupo y nunca darse por vencidas.
texts.en: Villistas is a united group of 8 hardworking people.  They are friends and they help each other to get ahead with their loan.  Nora is a good woman who has always fought for the wellbeing of her children.  She is 51 years old and married.  She has 5 children.  Nora earns a living selling corn, tamales and other food.  She decided to start her business because at one time she had a very sick child and she set out to help him improve.  She has already been working for 6 years and the loan will help her to buy some steamers as the ones she has are old and burned.  She will also buy more corn, charcoal, corn husks and dough to make tamales and other things.  A dream Nora would like to fulfill is to have her own restaurant and have a lot of customers.  This group is special and its members are outstanding people who think about the wellbeing of their families.  They desire to be the best group and to never give up.

loans.use: to buy steamers, corn, corn husks and dough for tamales, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Mercedes

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa y fue por iniciativa propia que emprendió este negocio. La mercadería la adquiere en la capital del país y viaja cada 15 días a comprarla. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar ropa y otros artículos de temporada navideña como juguetes. Con la inversión, podrá ofrecer más variedad a los clientes por lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y ampliar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is 42 years old and has one son. She has worked for many years selling clothes, and by her own initiative began her own business. She acquires her merchandise in the capital of El Salvador, and travels there every 15 days to make purchases. 

The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy clothing and other items for the Christmas season such as toys. With this investment, she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her clients, and hopes to improve her income and grow her business day by day as a result.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other items such as toys for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mayra De Los Dolores

texts.es: Mayra tiene 44 años de estado civil divorciada tiene 3 hijos de edad el mayor tiene 24 años el segundo tiene 18 años y el ultimo tiene 12 años el ultimo asiste a un colegio público y los 2 mayores asisten a una universidad de Guayaquil. Ella comenzó su taller  de costura hace 5 años atrás, ya que había estudiado esta actividad desde muy temprana edad. En la actualidad trabaja sola todos los días desde muy temprano y termina en la noche esto cuando tiene bastante trabajo, ya que ella trabajo bajo pedido. Con el préstamo quiere comprar otra máquina de coser, hilos, cierre etc. Su meta es ampliar mas su taller y poder contratar persona que no tengan un trabajo estable
texts.en: Mayra is 44 years old. She is divorced and has three sons. The eldest is 24 years old, the second is 18, and her youngest son is 12 years old. Her youngest son attends a public school and her two older sons attend a university in Guayaquil. She began her sewing workshop five years ago, since she had studied sewing at a young age. Currently, she works alone every day, starting early in the morning and finishing late at night when she is very busy; she works by request. With the loan she would like to buy another sewing machine, thread, closures, etc. Her goal is to expand her workshop and hire another person who doesn't have a stable job.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, thread, closures, etc.

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
Magdaleno tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos uno de 13 años  que estudia sexto grado y otro de diez años de edad que estudia tercer grado. Vive junto a su esposa que es ama de casa. magdaleno tiene 11 años de dedicarse a la venta de confitería para las tiendas. Él se encargada de distribuir la mercadería a alrededor de 60 tiendas al día a pie, trabaja de 6:30 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. se levanta a las 5:00 a.m.  Para salir de su casa a la ciudad y adquirir la mercadería a las 7:30 a.m. todos los días invierte $80 dólares y vende como mínimo $100 dólares a él le queda el 20 % de comisión y el resto es del fabricante. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un crédito pendiente con la institución y el resto para invertir en la compra de más confitería como: dulces, globos, etc. Él desea invertir más para obtener un margen más grande de ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
42-year old Magdaleno is married and has two children. His older son is 13 and in 6th grade. The younger is 10 and in grade 3. His wife works at home. Magdaleno has had his business for eleven years; he sells party supplies to stores. He is responsible for delivering his wares to about 60 stores every day on foot. He works from 6:30 am to 6:00 pm, and gets up at 5:00 am so he can get to town and buy the candy by 7:30 am. He spends about $80 and sells a minimum of $100. He earns 20% and the rest belongs to the manufacturer.

The loan Magdaleno is seeking will be used to cancel a debt he has with the institution and the rest to buy more merchandise such as candy and balloons. He wishes to invest in more stock in order to have a greater profit margin so he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay off a debt and buy more merchandise such as candy and balloons

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de hierro y chatarra junto con su esposo desde hace varios años. Estos materiales los compra de casa en casa y visita los pueblos cercanos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para incrementar su dinero para comprar más hierro y chatarra. De esta manera, tendrá disponibilidad de adquirir más producto para venderlos posteriormente. Su propósito, es siempre trabajar bien fuerte para apoyar a su familia en todo.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and married with two children. She has worked with her husband for many years buying and selling iron and scrap metal. She conducts her business house to house and visits nearby towns to make purchases and sales. 

The loan that she is asking for is to increase her funding to buy more iron and scrap metal. This way, she will be able to acquire more products for later sale. Her aim is to always work very hard in order to support all of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more iron and scrap metal

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
MARIA TOMASA
MARIA TOMASA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A LA VEZ SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ARTICULOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO Y COMPRA DE POLLOS. TOMASA ES BIEN RESPONSABLE YA HA TENIDO OTROS CREDITOS EN FAPE Y SIEMPRE HA SIDO PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE EN SU CREDITO, SU SUEÑO ES AGRANDAR MAS SU NEGOCIO Y SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA PARA ATENDER MEJOR A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Maria Tomasa runs a store selling consumer goods from her home. She also raises animals. Maria is seeking a loan to buy items for her store and chickens. 

She is a very responsible person and has had other loans with FAPE, always repaying them punctually. Her dream is to expand her business and buy more stock for it so she can provide her customers with better service.

loans.use: Buy more basic supplies for her store

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: María vive en el sur de Guayaquil en una zona llamada la Isla Trinitaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son  independientes. Ella comenzó su negocio de venta de víveres en general ya hace  15 años atrás decidió implementar su tienda de víveres en general al ver las necesidades  su barrio porque no había  ninguna tienda de víveres cerca de su casa. En la actualidad ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingo de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 e la noche. Con el préstamo  María comprara arroz, aceite, azúcar, bebidas, carnes  etc. Su meta  a futuro es  poder tener un mini market para así poder incrementar sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria lives in southern Guayaquil, in an area called Isla Trinitaria. She is married and has three children who are all adults and therefore independent. She began her business selling general groceries 15 years ago when she decided to open a grocery store after seeing the needs of her neighborhood as there wasn't a grocery store near her home. Currently, she works alone from Monday to Sunday from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. With the loan, Maria will buy rice, oil, sugar, drinks, meats, etc. Her future goal is to own a mini market and in that way increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, drinks, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy repair parts for his motorcycle taxi and if there is enough, to buy clothes to sell in his wife's business during December.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a vegetable dealer in the market. She has been in this type of business for 37 years. She is now 50 years of age and still has children to send to school. She says that she will not get tired of selling vegetables in the market until her children finish their education.

Anita aims to have her own farm lot for an additional source of income for the family. She will strive to attain her goal. She wanted to borrow 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy more vegetables in the village to sell in the market. She believes that, through the loan, she will quickly attain her goal.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables in the village to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Mayra es una socia activa que forma parte del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de cultura y tradiciones, su gente es trabajadora y emprendedora, es una ciudad que esta bañada por 4 ríos y su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno.

La Señora Mayra tiene 28 años de edad y es madre de soltera de 4 hijos de 10, 7 y 3 años y un bebé de 9 meses, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene una casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por un familiar.

La señora Mayra para salir en adelante con sus hijos se dedica a la venta de frutas, antes lo hacía recorriendo la ciudad pero desde hace 4 meses tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de frutas de temporada para su negocio.

 Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra is an active member of the communal bank Las Caleras. She lives in the Las Caleras neighborhood of Cuenca, Ecuador, a city that is full of culture and traditions. The people of Cuenca are very hardworking and entrepreneurial. It is a city surrounded by 4 rivers and the architecture is a mix of colonial and modern styles. 

Mayra is 28 years old and a single mother of four children - 10 years old, 7 years old, 3 years old, and 9 months old. Her two oldest children are studying in a school in the city. She does not have her own home but lives in a home owned by a relative. 

Mayra works selling fruit in order to support herself and her children. Previously she worked moving around the city, but as of 4 months ago she has her own stall in a market in the city. She works Mondays through Saturdays without a fixed schedule. 

This is the third loan that she has received from the communal bank, and she will invest her loan in buying fruit to sell in her stall. 

Her dream is to one day have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 34 years old and married with four children who attend school. She runs a small store selling grocery items and gains about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. 

She would like to increase and improve her income, which is why she is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise. She will buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, breads and biscuits to sell.
 
Edna would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur and to save funds for the education of her children. She will be happy and proud to see them as professionals in their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, breads and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario es una socia activa que forma parte del banco comunal Las Caleras, formando parte del grupo desde hace 15 años, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de cultura y tradiciones, su gente es trabajadora y emprendedora, es una ciudad que esta bañada por 4 ríos y su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno.

Doña Rosario tiene 72 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 8 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo por un problema de la columna ayuda en casa ya que no puede trabajar, la casa en la que viven  propia.

La Señora. Rosario se dedica a la elaboración de pan, fideos, tamales y café, vende estos productos todas las tardes en su casa. También cría pollos, borregos y ganado  del cual vende la leche a sus vecinas. 

Su crédito es para comprar pollos y cerdos. 

Su meta es tener más animales para ampliar esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Rosario is an active member of the communal bank Las Caleras. She has been part of this group for 15 years, and she lives in the Las Caleras neighborhood of Cuenca (Ecuador). The city has a very strong culture with lots of traditions, and people there are generally very hardworking and entrepreneurial. The city is surrounded by 4 rivers and its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern styles. 

Rosario is 72 years old, married, and has 9 children. 8 of them are married and live independently, and her single son works and helps her out financially. Her husband, as a result of a back problem, helps around the house as he can no longer work. They live in their own home. 

Rosario works making bread, noodles, tamales and coffee, and she sells these products every afternoon from her home. She also raises chickens, sheep, and other livestock, and she sells milk to her neighbors. 

With this loan she will buy chickens and pigs. 

Her goal is to have more animals in order to grow this part of her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Evangelyn has a child and lives together with her spouse in Padul. The family's income is derived through farming and motorcycle transport services, which her spouse manages. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos for the transport business. She will buy gasoline and paint for the motorcycle. 

In the future, Evangeline hopes to keep making their businesses profitable so they can save funds for a college education for her child to earn a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and paint for the motorcycle

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is happily married to Marlon, and they have two young children. She is now 36 years old and has managed her vegetable vending business for four years. 

Maricris offers vegetables on a house-to-house basis and earns 300 Philippine pesos each day. She is now asking for a loan to invest in more cabbage, tomatoes, beans and eggplant to sell. She would like to continuously offer good fresh vegetables and friendly services to her customers.
 
In the future, Maricris would like to keep improving sales and income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cabbage, tomatoes, beans and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
A banana dealer, Josephine earns her income by selling bananas at both wholesale and retail prices in the market. Josephine was only 12 years old when she was put to work, being trained on selling bananas in the market. She is now 56 years old and has two children. Josephine has been in the banana business for 44 years now. She started the business with no fixed location. At that time she didn't have her own stall where she could put the bananas. With her early profits from the business she was eventually able to pay rent and get a stall. 

Now Josephine wants to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy a larger quantity of bananas to sell in the market. Her goal is raising her profits, which she will save until she can buy a truck to use in hauling the products she sells, which will reduce her costs.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell in the market.

loans.name: Evelyn Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelyn Elizabeth, vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad, frijoles, arroz, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado el mercado de la localidad y es muy conocido, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además  del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Evelyn es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchas metas por delante, esta dispuesta a esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que solo así podrá cumplir sus sueños y llegar al éxito; como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar nuevas inversiones pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Evelyn Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Evelyn Elizabeth lives with her three children in her own house. She sells basic foodstuffs such as beans, rice, bread, instant products, and soap, among other items. She has had this business for a number of years, and this has given her valuable experience in sales, which allows her to obtain the best earnings. The business is located in the local market and is very well known. She has many customers, since people prefer her because everything that she sells is of first quality and is affordably priced. In addition, she provides unequaled service. She is always ready to serve her customers. 

Evelyn is an energetic and hard-working woman with many goals for the future. She is ready to strive to the maximum since she knows that only in this way will she be able to accomplish her dreams and reach success. Like all good businesswomen, she wants to augment her business and make new investments, but she doesn't have sufficient capital and this is why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy basic foodstuffs, bread, candy, instant products, beverages, soaps, etc. Evelyn Elizabeth has good payment references, and she assures that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time she has faith that she will be able to bring economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, bread, candies, instant products, beverages, and soap for her store

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural area of Mongkul Borey district located in Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia, Kunthea is 28 years of age and married. She is blessed with one daughter and one son, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To make a living, Kunthea has been involved in a rice growing business for nearly ten years, which enables her to earn around 24,000 KHR per day and save approximately 11,000 KHR for future needs after offsetting her daily expenses. Kunthea has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in keeping her beloved kids in school and meeting her family’s needs. 

In hopes of smoothly operating her rice field, Kunthea is now leading a group of four female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 KHR total. This group leader, Kunthea, will spend her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and to pay labor fees. With the help of her requested loan portion, Kunthea believes that her business will provide a good quality crop so that she can earn more income for the family and save up some money to expand her business as well as advance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Sinet is a 29-year-old, married mother, who lives with her husband in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children, who are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of the family’s income is cassava planting on 2.5 hectares of farmland. Sinet has been in this business for several years, to make a living. Her daily income is approximately 24,000 KHR per day, and Sinet can manage to save about 7,000 KHR per day, after offsetting daily living expenses.
 
Sinet has been a member of VisionFund for five loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loan, which helped her to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihoods. Now she is asking for another loan with VisionFund, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. With this new loan, she will buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for farm labor, and she wants to buy an additional plot of farmland for her farming business. Sinet hopes to grow her rice more fruitfully and timely, so as to better her standard of living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pay for farm labor, and buy an additional plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Channov's Group

texts.en:
Channov, 48, resides in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is married and has six children, three of whom are under her responsibility. 

Channov makes her living through farming rice and planting cassava, the business in which she has been involved for more than 15 years. Her business enables her to earn around 25,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and to save approximately 15,000 KHR after deducting her daily expenses. 

Channov is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her first loan, which she successfully paid back, helped her to increase crop yields and earn more income for the family. 

Now, she is leading a loan group of two female members. She will use her requested loan portion, which is 2,000,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer to support her farmland and a horse. This hard-working woman would like to dedicate all of her efforts to moving her family ahead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a horse

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally’s dream is for her two children to finish their education and have stable jobs. Her dreams for her children teach her to strive and survive whatever hindrances she may encounter.
 
Sally is 47 years of age and married. Her husband is a driver. She owns a glassware business, which generates a profit. She has been in her business for 16 years. 

She wants her business to improve more and to increase the products she sells to her costumers. However, she can’t pursue these wants because she does not have enough capital. 

Thus, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy water jugs, glasses and plates to sell in the market. She hopes to use her profits to enable her children to complete their education and to not depend on them soon.

loans.use: to buy water jugs, glasses and plates.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is married and has two children. Geraldine engages in a direct-selling business in which she sells fragrances, lotions, shampoo, and lipstick. Geraldine started in the business as a franchise dealer almost two years ago. Then, she realized that if she had her own stall, she would increase her income from the business. 

Geraldine just started her own business eight months ago. Her goal is to expand her stall and purchase additional products to sell. She wishes for a loan of P30,000 to purchase underwear, cologne, and makeup to sell. Geraldine is striving to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase underwear, cologne, and makeup to sell.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang is a 49-year-old married mother who lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been planting cassava and raising pigs for ten years. The business earns her approximately 24,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Nang has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She has wisely used the past loans to improve her standard of living. Now Nang is requesting another loan, of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and spend a portion on household supplies. She hopes to grow her rice in a healthy and productive manner, so that she can sell it for a good price, improve her standard of living, and fulfill her dream of building a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy household supplies.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong resides in a rural area of the Preahnet Preah district in Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. She is a 36-year-old married woman with six children, four (two daughters and two sons) of whom are dependent on her. 

Hong earns her living through farming rice, the business in which she has been involved for 13 years. She earns around 23,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save approximately 9,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Due to insufficient working capital to support her rice field, she is now leading a group of four members to take out a loan for 3,400,000 KHR in total. Hong is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan, which she successfully paid back, helped to support her rice field and improve her family’s living standard. 

Now, with her requested loan portion of 600,000 KHR, Hong will spend part of it to buy fertilizer to support her rice field and the other portion to buy household supplies. After receiving her portion in this loan, Hong expects to see a boost in her income. She will save money to build an appropriate and warm house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Moisés Ángel

texts.es: Moisés Ángel vive junto a su familia; él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado desde hace ya varios años, ha ganado mucha experiencia valiosa en las ventas y eso le ha regalado muy buenas ganancias, comercia desde el lugar que califico como muy bueno para su negocio  en diferentes zonas de la comunidad donde vive, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque posee producto de calidad , a muy buen precio, además de servicio excelente; Moisés se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es un hombre emprendedor dedicado a su labor, siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le ayuden a encontrar un futuro mas prospero, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, últimamente han aumentado las ventas y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuero, pegamento, suelas, etc. Moisés Angel  tiene excelentes referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Moisés Ángel lives with his family.  He has been making and selling shoes for several years.  He has gained a lot of valuable sales experience, and this has rewarded him with very good income.  He sells from a place that he described as being very good for his business in different areas of the community where he lives.  He has a lot of clientele.  People prefer him because he has quality products at a very good price, and he provides excellent service.

Moisés is known for his great kindness and honesty.  He is an enterprising man who is devoted to his work.  He is always looking for the best alternatives that will help him find a more prosperous future.  Every day he puts forth maximum effort because he knows that this is the only way to achieve what he desires.  

Lately sales have increased, and he wants to take advantage of this in order to make a new investment.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy leather, glue, and soles, etc.  Moisés Ángel has excellent payment references, and he is very responsible.  He affirms that he will be able to repay the debt, and he trusts that he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, and soles.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province. She is aged 46 years and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependents; one is still in school, while the remaining one helps in the family business. To support the family, Sophat and her husband have been in a farming business for six years.
 
Sophat’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Sophat fully paid back her past loans, which have helped her support her family with better living conditions. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan of KHR 1,400,000, each person. As the leader, Sophat will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland, and to buy gasoline for water pumping. Sophat hopes to get a high yield from her farming business, so as to improve her family’s living conditions and keep their child in school.

loans.use: To buy inputs for farming and gasoline for water pumping

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
Non, a 34-year-old married woman, lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children.

To make a living, she has been farming rice for fourteen years while her husband works for others for a fee in the village. Non and her husband can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR a day, after offsetting for daily expenses.

Non’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and have both paid back their past loans in full. Non wisely used the previous loan for her children's education and to support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a second loan. As the leader, Non will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to successfully grow her rice and earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 57 years old and married. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for twenty-eight years and supplement their family’s income by raising chickens to better support their big family. They are able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR per day after deducting expenses.

Pov’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is on her eighth loan cycle with Kiva’s Field Partner, VisionFund, while the other member is on her second cycle. The past loans have helped her family to obtain sufficient food.

Now leading her group to apply for another loan, Pov, the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and will use a portion of it to buy chicken feed. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn a large income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Kim is a 31-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from growing rice and raising pigs, which Kim has been involved in for six years. With her current business, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day but she can only save about 10,000 KHR a day after deducting expenses.

Kim has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while the other members of the group have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Kim successfully paid back the past loans, which enabled her to support her family. Now she is leading her group of three in seeking a new loan. Kim, the leader, will use her potion to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland and will also use some of it to buy pig feed.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland and to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Kimyoen

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Battambang province, Kimyoen is a 42-year-old, married mother of two children. One of her children is still dependent on her and in school. She and her husband have been in the farming business, growing crops such as rice, cassava, corn and oranges to make a living. For additional income, they also keep six cows. Together, they can earn about 57,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and they manage to save about 17,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Kimyoen is seeking her first-cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming business. With this loan, she hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of the rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district, Samet is 33 years old and married with two dependent children who are still in school.

To make a living and support their family, Samet and her husband have been farming rice on four hectares of farmland as their primary business for ten years. Her family’s daily income is about 30,000 KHR but she can only manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Samet has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has successfully paid back the past loan. The other member of the group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Samet wisely used her previous loan to support her children’s education.

Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan of 500,000 KHR each. Samet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use part of it to buy household supplies for the family. She hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income in order to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and household supplies for the family.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Eab's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Eab is 41 years old and lives in a rural village in Cambodia’s Moung Russey district.  One of her four children still attends school and remains dependent on her.  To support the family, she and her husband farm rice on three hectares of farmland as the main source of the family’s income.  They have been in business for 10 years.  In addition, they occasionally work for others for a fee.

Eab is in her second loan cycle with VisionFund while her group member is in her third cycle.  Eab completely repaid the first loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden.  She now earns about 20,000 KHR per day from her current business and she is able to save about 12,000 KHR each day.  Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan.  As the leader, she wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income so that she can improve their standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 34-year-old farmer who lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school.

Thy grows cassava on five hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for fourteen years, she is able to earn about 54,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day, after offsetting for daily expenses.

This is Thy’s first loan with Kiva’s Field Partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. Thy wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava-growing business. With the loan she hopes to grow her cassava timely and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price in order to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava-growing business.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Khorn is 46 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school.  He and his wife are hard-working farmers who earn a living through farming rice and making palm juice. They have been in this business for ten years and can earn about US $6 per day and manage to save about US $3 each day after expenses. 

Khorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan which helped him to relieve his family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is applying for a loan of US $500. He is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying bricks to renovate his house. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice fruitfully and also help him to have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en:
Sithon, 36, is a single woman and lives in a village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer and she supplements her family’s income through working as a tailor in the village. She has been in this business for ten years, earning about US $5 per day and managing to save about US $2 each day after daily expenses.

Sithon is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a loan of US $300. She is going to use this loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sokkhoern

texts.en:
Sokkhoern is 54 years old.   She is married and the mother of nine children living in a rural village of Cambodia’s Bakan district.  Two of her nine children remain dependent on her and attend school.  To support her family, Sokkhoern has been farming rice for 30 years in the village.  She earns about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business to meet the family’s needs.

Sokkhoern is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund.  She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She will also use a portion of this loan to buy household supplies for her family.  Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income so that she can improve her family’s standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and household supplies for her family.

loans.name: Phav

texts.en:
Phav lives in a rural village in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province.  He is 32 years old and the father three children, all of whom are dependent on him and attend school.  He earns a living by farming rice on five hectares of farmland and also plants vegetables as the main sources of the family’s income.  He has been in this business for almost 10 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day and managing to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phav is in his first loan cycle with VisionFund.  Now he is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR.  He wants to use this loan to renovate his old house.  He hopes this loan will enable him to have a larger house for the family to live in.

loans.use: to renovate his old house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Soey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Soey is a 46-year-old widow with two children.  Only one of the two children remains dependent on her.  The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland.  She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Soey has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely repaid her previous loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood.  Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan.  Soey, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland as well as to purchase piglets to raise and earn additional income for the family.  She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner so that she can sell it for a good price and improve her family’s standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su vive junto a su compañera de vida Reina y sus hijos en casa propia; él posee una herrería donde elaboran rejas, muebles, esculturas, herramientas, artículos decorativos y religiosos, campanas entre otros, es muy conocido por las personas del lugar, y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque es muy confiable, tiene excelentes precios y un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Mario se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad es muy humilde y siempre esta dedicado a su labor, le gusta luchar por lo que desea por eso se esfuerza dia a dia para ganarse un futuro mas prospero y así obtener el éxito que se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y necesita invertir para no decepcionar a la clientela, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un comprar hierro por mayor . Mario Alberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente satisfecho con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is 39 years old and lives with his life partner, Reina, and their children in their own house. He owns a blacksmith workshop where he makes bars, furniture, sculptures, tools, decorative and religious articles, and bells, among other things. He is well-known around his community and has a good clientele. People prefer him because he is trustworthy, has great prices, and unbeatable service upon request. 

Mario is very friendly and honest; he is very humble and is always dedicated to his work. He enjoyings fighting for what he wants and for this reason he strives every day to earn a more prosperous future and thus succeed as he deserves.
 
During the last few weeks, demand has increased and he needs to invest in materials so as not to disappoint his clients, but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he requests a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy iron at wholesale. Mario Alberto has good payment references and is very responsible. He is satisfied with the help and assures that he can repay the debt. At the same time, he is confident that he will be able to offer economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy iron at wholesale.

loans.name: Thoen's Group

texts.en:
Thoen, 55 years old, is married and has one son, who is still in school. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is involved in farming rice on a three-hectare plot of farmland and in selling groceries in the village. She can earn about 10,000 KHR per day from the current businesses and manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after meeting expenses.

Thoen’s group consists of three members who are new to VisionFund this cycle. Thoen is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use part of her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use part of to buy more grocery items for resale. Touch hopes to earn a large income for the family in order to make a better living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and groceries for resale.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Oho Alix Sylvie

texts.fr:
Madame OHO ALIX SYLVIE est célibataire avec 01 enfant. l'enfant a 03ans et ne va pas à l’école. OHO ALIX SYLVIE a une personne à sa charge.
Elle est étudiante  en classe de licence II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Madame veut financer ses études supérieures.
Elle fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après les  études, elle compte travailler et créer sa propre entreprise ; ensuite se marier.
texts.en:
Ms. Oho Alix Sylvie is single with one child. The child is three years old and does not attend school. Oho Alix Sylvie has one dependent.  

For the past two years, she has been a student in the Professional License Level II program at ESTPO (University of Public Works in Ouagadougou).  ESTPO is the best civil engineering school in the country.  

Oho Alix Sylvie wants to finance her higher education.  

She has completed internships during school vacations to acquire work experience.  After graduation, she plans to work and start her own business, then get married.

loans.use: to finance her higher education.

loans.name: Cleydi Somaira

texts.es: Cleydi Somaira de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos tazas, vasos, coladores entre otros además comercia películas navideñas aprovechando la época que pronto se acerca, tiene varios años con el negocio se ha hecho de muy buena experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener el máximo de ganancias,  comercia de forma ambulante, es muy conocida y ya tiene mucha clientela quela prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Cleydi es una mujer que se caracteriza por su amabilidad y honestidad, es totalmente dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, cada dia se esfuerza al máximo por encontrar esas oportunidades que le permitan llegar al éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda en el negocio y quiere aprovechar a una nueva inversión para no decepcionar a los clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos plásticos y películas navideñas. Cleydi Somaira tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente feliz con el apoyo, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Cleydi Somaira, 38, lives with her life partner and her two children.  She makes a living selling plastic products: cups, glasses, colanders, and other things.  She also sells Christmas movies, making the most of the season that's quickly approaching.

She has had the business for several years and has acquired very good experience in sales, which allows her to get maximum profits.  She sells as a street vendor and is very well known because she has a lot of customers who prefer her for the quality, good prices, and excellent service.

Cleydi's known for her kindness and honesty.  She's enterprising and completely devoted to her job, with a great desire to get ahead.  Every day she makes the maximum effort to find those opportunities that will allow her to be successful.

Demand has increased in her business in recent weeks and she wants to make the most of another investment so the customers won't be disappointed.  This is why she's asking Integral for a loan to buy plastic products and Christmas movies.

Cleydi Somaira has a good payment record and is very responsible.  She's happy about the support and is certain that she'll be able to repay the debt.  She also trusts that she'll be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy plastic products and Christmas movies

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado has been engaged in a farming business since 1975. He is married and has nine children. Three of his children are married; four are working; one is studying and the other one left is out of school. According to Amado, the profit gained from his farming business was used for their household needs and education of his children during their school days.

Amado cultivates his 8 hectares of rice field. He is able to expand his rice field through his hard labor and determination in life. Now at age 61, he still aims for a better income so he could let his youngest child finish his studies and save some for his emergency purposes for when he gets weak. For him to obtain his goal, he is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP30,000. He will use this loan amount in buying fertilizer and necessary insecticides to ensure proper growth of his rice crops.

loans.use: to be used for buying fertilizer and insecticide for his rice farming business

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo Antonio de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Yamileth y su hija en casa propia;  él se dedica a la venta a la venta de pan dulce en variedad, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia  en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia de forma ambulante en su vehículo y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Eduardo es un hombre activo, dedicado a su labor, honesto y sobre todo luchador, para él lo mas impórtate es nunca rendirse aunque existan adversidades pues tarde o temprano siempre se abren las puertas al éxito, en la ultima semana aumentaron las ventas y desea realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan por mayor y para el mantenimiento del vehículo. Eduardo Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable se siente muy contenta con la ayuda y por lo cual asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le  dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Eduardo Antonio is 26 years old and lives with his life partner Yamileth and their daughter in their own house. He makes a living from selling a variety of sweet bread products. He has been working in this business for a few years, which has given him a lot of experience in sales and has allowed him to make better profits. He sells the products out of his car and has many clients. People prefer him for the quality of his products, his good prices, and his excellent service.

Eduardo is an active man, dedicated to his work, honest and, above all, a fighter. For him, it is most important to never give up even though obstacles exist, because sooner or later the doors to success always open. 

During the past week, his sales have increased and he would like to invest in his business again. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy bread at wholesale and do maintenance on his car. Eduardo Antonio has good payment references and impeccable morals. He is very happy with the help and assures that he can repay the debt. At the same time, he is confident that he can offer his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread at wholesale and do maintenance on  his car.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a widower who is blessed with three children. Two of his children are married, and the other one is no longer studying.

Edwin owns a two-hectare rice farm, and he is raising two fattening hogs. He is glad that his hogs are healthy, as he has spent much of his profit on them. The capital available for his farm is no longer sufficient, which is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000, to allow him to buy farm inputs and prepare his land for farming. He is hoping for approval of his loan, so he can make his farming more productive and profitable, thus enabling him to earn a better income to meet his family needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare his field for farming.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida  Marta y sus hijos, el se dedica a la venta  de frutas y verduras tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la localidad, es muy conocido y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Rafael es una hombre emprendedor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, como toda buen comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar Frutas y verduras por mayor etc. Rafael tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is 51 years old and lives with his life companion Marta and their children. He sells fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, chile peppers, and other types of produce. Rafael has been in business for several years and gained plenty of sales experience, which has allowed him to generate more income. He sells as a traveling merchant in different areas of town. Rafael is well-known and has many established customers who prefer to do business with him because everything he sells is of high-quality and offered at affordable prices. Most of all, he provides excellent service.

Rafael is an enterprising gentleman who has the drive to move forward. He is always expecting new opportunities that will allow him to attain the level of success that he wants. Rafael needs financial backing in order to make a new investment, so he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. The money will enable him to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

Rafael has good credit references and is very responsible. He is confident that he will repay this debt and be able to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo lives in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, a place known to be mountainous. The primary source of their income is their livestock and farming business. Nilo is 41 years old, married to an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), and has two children.

Nilo raises hogs and is a farmer. He started his agricultural business in 1988. He is thankful to  God because he couldn't make his business productive without Him. In the absence of his wife, he acts as both father and mother to his two children. Despite his situation, he is able to manage his time wisely on both his family and his business. Nilo is fattening seven hogs and growing corn on his two and a half hectare corn farm. All he wants in life to get ahead, educate his two children, and improve their standard of living.

Nilo would like to ensure proper growth of his hogs, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000, which will be used to buy vitamins and hog feed. He is hoping for approval of this loan amount. In this way, he can fulfill his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. All her children are still in school. To support her family, she and her husband grow rice, on three hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, they can earn about KHR 10,000 per day together, and they manage to save about KHR 5,000 each day after daily expenses.
 
Touch has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund either two or three cycles. Touch fully repaid her loans, and she has wisely used the previous loans to buy a tractor to help in her farming business. Now she is leading her group of five members to request a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use a portion of her share of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and another portion to pay for labor to plow the field. Touch hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so she can improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and pay for labor to plow.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора 46 лет замужем имеет двоих детей. Гульнора трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. В поисках источника дохода в 1995 году Гульнора начала свой бизнес с суммой 150 сомони продавала мелкие товары (мыло, порошки,шампуни). Благодаря упорному труду она расширила свой бизнес. А муж Гульноры ремонтирует дома и помогает ей по бизнесу. На полученные доходы они построили небольшой уютный дом для своих детей. С 2005 года Гульнора кредитуется в нашей организации и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования и в течении 7 лет она доказала свою пунктуальность и добросовестность. На полученный кредит Гульнора хочет расширить свой ассортимент товаров и закупить хозяйственные товары. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Gulnora is 46 years old and is married with two children.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman.  While searching for a source of income in 1995, Gulnora started her own business with 150 somoni selling sundries (soap, powders, shampoo).  Because of her diligence, she has expanded her business.  Gulnora's husband is repairing their house and helping her with her business.  With the proceeds from the business, they have built a small and comfortable home for their children.  Since 2005, Gulnora has been a borrower with our organization and she has never once violated her loan terms and in the period of seven years she has shown herself to be punctual and trustworthy.  On receiving her loan, Gulnora wants to expand her assortment of goods and buy some household items.  She is awaiting your help and support.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile is in her fifties and married. She and her family live in northern Albania, in a little town of approximately 10,000 people. Prior to residing in this town, they lived almost all of their lives in another region where she was employed as a pharmacist. She has always been the only financial provider for her family. With her income, she even paid her children's university tuition fees.

About three years ago, Dile opened her own drugstore, and she has established a steady clientele. She says she is very proud of her business.

Dile is requesting a loan of 150,000 ALL to purchase pharmaceuticals and other items for her store's inventory. This will be her second loan; the previous loan has been paid in full.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceuticals and other items for her drugstore

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi has a business selling surplus spare parts for vehicles. Her partner in managing the business is her husband. They have managed the business for eight years, and still hope to develop their business further. Noemi started the business by buying and selling in different villages. Once they had enough earnings, they decided to put up a stall in front of their house.

Noemi has not stopped dreaming. At present, her dreams include having their own car, a better house for more comfortable living, and sending their four children to school to finish their education. 

Noemi wants to sell rare spare parts that they seldom have to sell. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy spare parts to sell. She and her husband will work hard to bring her dreams to fruition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is in her forties, married, and has four children. She is engaged in the sari-sari store (convenience store) business, which produces her income. Nenita’s children are in school. Her income from the business provides for her children’s daily allowances in school.
As she manages her business, she learns from her experience, so she is now growing her business. Nenita has been managing this business for two years, and she is eager to continue. Nenita wishes for continued growth of her business. She considers that, by borrowing 50,000 PHP, she can extend the range of products she offers in their village. She plans to buy cases of soft drinks and other beverages. She hopes to increase her income and make her business succeed.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and other beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mubin

texts.ru: Мубин  молодой энергичный мужчина по специальности преподаватель, обучает детей  в сельской школе и заодно занимается торговлей, так как на одну зарплату невозможно содержать семью и накопить денег для крупных расходов. Он решил получить кредит для покупки бытовой техники, так как недавно стали отдельно жить от родителей.   Мубин хочет обставить свой дом и приобрести необходимые вещи для хозяйства,но все сразу невозможно приобрести поэтому он   решил взять   кредит.  На полученный кредит хочет купить  холодильник. Заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mubin is a young, energetic man who works as a teacher.  He teaches children in the village school and at the same time he works as a shopkeeper, since it is impossible for him to support his family on just one salary and to save money for big expenses.  Mubin has decided to apply for a loan to buy some home appliances, since he and his family recently moved out of his parents' house.  He wants to furnish his home and buy the necessary things for his household, but this is not possible all at once, which is why he decided to ask for a loan.  On receiving the loan, he would like to buy a refrigerator.  He gives thanks in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Gjeline

texts.en:
Gjeline, a villager in her fifties, has four children, with one of them still attending school. She and her family have been persecuted during the communist era, the leadership of Enver Hoxha and she and others including her family had hard lives, Gjeline said. 

This will be her first loan and she is requesting it to buy a milk cow because a couple months back the one she had unfortunately died. She lives in a rural village, very high in the northern mountains. 

Her main activity for all these twenty years has been in agriculture/livestock and she’s been selling veggies, grains and also dairy products to the locals.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a  sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda, vende arroz, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón, entre otros además comercializa paletas y productos helados desde su negocio o de forma ambulante, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además  del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Santos es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchas metas por delante, esta dispuesta a esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que solo así podrá cumplir sus sueños y llegar al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar nuevas inversiones pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, pan, paletas, hielo, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Santos tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old and lives with her children in her own home. She has a store where she sells rice, bread, instant products, and soap. Santos also sells popsicles and ice cream products from her business and as a street vendor. She has managed her business for several years and has gained valuable sales experience, which has allowed her to generate more income. Santos is well-known and has many customers who prefer to do business with her because everything she sells is of first-rate quality and offered at affordable prices. In addition, her service is unequaled since she always considers her customers her first priority.

Santos is an energetic and hardworking woman who has many goals that she would like to accomplish. She is willing to do her best because she knows that is the only way for her to fulfill her dreams and become successful. Like any good merchant, Santos wants to grow her business and make new investments. However, she does not have sufficient capital, so she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. The money will enable her to buy bread, popsicles, ice, snack foods, instant products, beverages, soaps, and other items.

Santos has good credit references and is confident that she will repay this debt. At the same time, she has faith that she will be able to provide financial stability for her household.

loans.use: to buy bread, popsicles, ice, snack foods, instant products, beverages, soaps, and other items.

loans.name: Gladys Monserrate

texts.es: Gladys tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que ya  son independientes. Ella comenzó su taller de costura hace muchos años atrás cuando se compra una máquina de coser y puso un letrero fuera de su casa diciendo se confecciona ropa y tuvo mucha acogida entre vecinos y amigos por lo pronto, Gladys tuvo un capital y compro mas máquina de coser. En la actualidad trabajan con 2 ayudantes de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el crédito comprara otra máquina de coser, hilos, cierres etc. Su meta e poder enseñarles este oficio a muchas personas y así poder brindar trabajo a mucha gente que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old, divorced, and has two grown and independent children. She began her sewing business many years ago when she bought a sewing machine and put a sign outside of her house saying she made clothes. Soon after she had a lot of business from neighbors and friends, and had enough money to buy another sewing machine. She currently works with two assistants, Mondays through Saturdays, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. 

With this loan, she will buy another sewing machine, thread, and other sewing materials. Her goal is to be able to teach many people how to sew, in order to provide work for people who need it.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, thread, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children -- two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a government employee. Both daughters are married, an elder son is a government employee, and the younger one is a taxi driver.

Since 2004 Shahnaz has been in the business of selling milk, which comes from her three buffaloes. She provides a valuable service in her community by selling milk to many of her neighbors. Her sons help her with her business, as does her husband.

As the winter season has started she wants to construct a small dairy farm consisting of two rooms outside of her house to protect the animals from the severe cold. However, due to the lack of finances she is unable to do this.

As a member of four-person lending group she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

She hopes to get more profit from her small dairy business and desires to buy one cow from the profit amount in the future.

She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Shahnaz holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to construct a small dairy farm for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia vive junto a su hijo y nietos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente; Rosa  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Rosa Lidia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable esta satisfecha con el apoyo, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia lives with her son and grandchildren. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, soap, and other products. Rosa has been in business for several years and has gained a great deal of sales experience, which has allowed her to generate more income. She is well-known in her town since people recommend her store because it is always stocked. Her customers are always looking for affordable prices, quality products, and excellent service.

Rosa is a woman who is dedicated to her work, energetic, and motivated to succeed. She enjoys the process of chasing her dreams, so she strives to do her best to attain them. As a result, she has had much success in life. Like any good merchant, she wants to grow her business so she will make a new investment with the loan she requested from Apoyo Integral. This loan will enable her to buy basic grains, snack foods, bread, instant products, beverages, soap, and other items.

Rosa Lidia has good credit references and moral character beyond reproach. She is pleased to have this support and is certain that she will be able to repay this debt. Rosa is also confident that she can provide financial security for her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snack foods, bread, instant products, beverages, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Elyse Marie Lydie

texts.fr:
Madame ELYSE MARIE LYDIE  est célibataire sans enfant.
Elle est étudiante  en classe de licence II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Madame veut financer ses études supérieures.
  Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après les  études, elle souhaite travailler et si possible créer sa propre entreprise.
texts.en:
ELYSE MARIE LYDIE is a single woman without children. She is enrolled at the ESTPO (Graduate School of Public Works of Ouagadougou), and has been a student in the 2nd year of the professional licence program for the past two years. The ESTPO is a reference school for civil engineering education in the country. 

She wishes to finance her graduate studies. She spends her time off getting on-the-job training to acquire practical experience. After graduation, she wants find employment and start her own business.

loans.use: to finance her graduate studies.

loans.name: Kamolot

texts.ru: Камолот  пожилая женщина, которая занимается животноводством. Муж её пастух. Они имеют двоих  детей.  Камолот всю свою жизнь занимается откармливанием скота так как не имеет образования и другой работы. Дети помогают выращивать скот.   Это единственный доход и Камолот старается развивать этот бизнес.  На полученный кредит она хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Камолот благодарит такие организации как Арванд потому что, с помощью таких организаций люди которые нуждаются в финансовой поддержке могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Kamolot is an older woman who raises livestock.  Her husband is a shepherd and they have two children.  Kamolot has been involved in raising animals her whole life, so she has no other education or work experience.  Her children help her around the farm.  This is her only source of income and Kamolot is trying to expand her business.  On receiving her loan, she would like to buy some cattle and increase the size of her herd.  Kamolot is thankful for organizations like Arvand because with their help, people who need financial support can implement their plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ramona Guadalupe

texts.es: Ramona vive en un sector periurbano  de la ciudad de Guayaquil llamado Guasmo, tiene 57 años de edad   es soltera y tiene hijos mayores de edad por  lo ya que son independientes. Ella a raíz de la separación de su ex pareja toma la decisión de buscar trabajo y como nadie le dada la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa, junto dinero que tenia y dio apertura a su negocio propio que es una tienda de víveres en general. En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda de víveres todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo comprara  arroz, azúcar harina, vitrinas  y arreglara su local, etc. Su meta es tener un mini market  reconocido en la ciudad para satisfacer las necesidades de los consumidores.
texts.en:
Ramona lives in the semi-urban area around the city of Guyaquil called Guasmo. She is 57 years old, single, and has two grown, independent children.
