Jesus is a 50-year-old farmer living at Lanna with his wife and four children. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He had been doing so for over 10 years.

He usually gains 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) twice a year during harvest season. He uses it properly to pay matriculation fees, bills at home and meals for his family. 

Jesus is now asking for a loan of 45,000 PHP to improve his farming business. He will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in rice farming. 

He would like to keep providing a good education for his children. Someday, with good harvests and income, he will achieve income stability and make his family live fortunately.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in rice farming

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga is 52 years old and lives in the rural area of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of two children, one of whom is still in school. To earn a living, Nga has been working in a rice field. She also supplements the family’s income by growing vegetables. She has been in this business for ten years. She is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after deducting daily living expenses. 

Nga has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and successfully paid back her previous loans. The other group member is new with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loans have helped Nga to support her family. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for a new loan. Nga will use her portion of the new loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to get a high yield from her farming business, to better her living conditions and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.en:
Desiderio is a rice grower in Lanna. He is 45 years old and married. He has four children in school. His wife Luisa is a vegetable vendor. They work hand-in-hand to improve their living conditions. 

Desiderio gains an income of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) twice a year, during harvest season, from selling his crops. He aims to improve his production.

Increasing production would require farm inputs to sustain his crops, but he has insufficient funds. That is why he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. 

With enough sustenance, his crop production will improve. He will be able to harvest it profitably and earn the income necessary to pay for all tuition fees and his family's daily needs. He also would like to save funds for unexpected expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is a responsible 33-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a salesman and works very hard to meet his family's needs. Both of her sons are students. Rabia dreams of having her own house where she can live happily with her husband and children, as currently she is living in her brother-in-law's house with her family.

Since 2009, Rabia has owned a small garment business at home to contribute to her family's income. Her garment business is going well. As the winter season has started, she is interested in purchasing some warm products like sweaters, coats, gloves, caps, etc. so that she can sell a variety of warm clothes to her customers. However, due to the lack of capital, she is unable to purchase warm clothes. 

Rabia, as a member of a 7-person lending group, has therefore requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can increase her profit as well as her monthly savings so she can provide a better future of her children.

Rabia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. 

Note: In the photo, Rabia is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of warm clothes to sell

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.en:
Salvadora is a very patient and hardworking wife and mother. She is married to Francisco and they have four children who all attend school. The couple plant and harvest rice to sell to traders and they usually gain about P30,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. The money from the business goes towards meals and allowances for their children. She aims to continuously give her children a good education which is the only inheritance she can pass on to them. 

To meet her goal, she needs to increase crop production so that her income will increase too. For this, she is borrowing P40,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides to use in the rice field. It will nourish the crops and ensure good harvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides to use in the rice field

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Mr SALIF est célibataire sans enfant.
Il  est étudiant  en classe de TS (Technicien Supérieur)II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Après les  études son ambition en tant que étudiant en génie civil est d’être un ingénieur des travaux publics  et voir après si les moyens lui permettent de créer sa propre entreprise.
texts.en:
Salif is single and he has no children. 
For the past two years, he has been enrolled at the ESTPO or "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works), where he is a graduate student. The ESTPO is a top civil engineering school in our country.
W. Ghislain wants to finance his graduate studies. After graduation, his dream is to become a civil engineer.  Later on, if he has the necessary resources, he would like to create his own company.

loans.use: to finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en:
Joselita's greatest dream in life is that her six children should finish their education. By retailing of clothes and blankets she has been able to meet their basic needs in their household. Joselita is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver.

Joselita sells clothes in the market. She has been in this business for 19 years. Joselita is striving. She is the one who manages the business and no one assists her in selling. Joselita aims for the growth of the business. She wants to add some clothes to sell, to increase her profit and cover the school expenses of her children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy pants, dresses and underwear. She looks toward the success of the business and the time when she can realize her greatest dream in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses and underwear

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Originally from the Bavel district of Battambang Province, Cambodia, Thavy is aged 39 years and married. She is the mother of five children, four of whom are her dependents and still in school. To make a living, Thavy has been working as a rice farmer in her local area for several years, while her husband works for others for a wage. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business, and she can save about 15,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.
 
Thavy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles. She completely paid back the prior loans. She successfully used them to support her family with sufficient food, as well as to pay for her children’s education. Now she is applying for a loan of US$1,000. She will use part of this loan to buy wood for building a decent house, and part of it to buy household supplies. Through this loan, Thavy hopes to have a decent house for living in, which will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy wood for building a decent house

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak, 60, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Seak has struggled to feed the family by farming rice for thirty years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to spend for her family’s needs. The main challenge for her farming business is insufficient working capital to support her business.

Seak has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other members are just with VisionFund this cycle. Seak completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the small village of Villa Domingo. She is 54 years old and married with four children. 

Editha is willing to work hard to lift her family from poor living. That's why she is busy managing their farm land with her husband. 

Editha has been engaged in her business for 30 years. She usually earns about 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every crop season. Right now, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and seedlings to sustain the proper growth of her business. 

She believes that, through her loan, she can obtain the farm supplies that she needs for her business. She also hopes to increase her income to secure the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings to sustain the proper growth of her business

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is 55 years old and a married mother of six children. Her family lives in a rural village in the Bavel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and planting oranges on eight hectares of farmland for fifteen years to support her family. She is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 15,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Sophorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which have supported her in expanding her farming business. Now she is asking for a new loan with VisionFund of US $1,000. Sophorn will use a portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a large income so as to make her family’s condition better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a farmer in the Philippines. He is 40 years old and married to Donita. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. 

To generate income, Bernardo is busy growing rice. He has been engaged in rice production for 23 years and usually earns about 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest. 

At this time, Bernardo is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy farm supplies, such as seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides, for the proper growth of the business. He hopes to increase his income in the next cropping season.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Kimleang's Group

texts.en:
Kimleang, 33, is married and has three dependent children, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof, located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main sources of her family’s income are rice farming, selling fish in her village, and her husband's work of catching fish. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about KHR 18,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR 8,000 each day. 

Kimleang’s group consists of two members, who have each been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. Kimleang successfully paid back the previous loan, which helped her to better support her family's living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Kimleang, who is leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming business. She hopes to increase her crop yield, to earn more income and make a better living, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Melicio

texts.en:
Melicio started his farming business at the age of 23. After his high school graduation, he devoted his time to cultivating his rice field. Melecio is now 29 years of age, and married with two children.

Melicio plants rice crops on his 2.2 hectares of rice fields. His main goal is to obtain a plentiful harvest this next crop season. To make this goal possible, he is asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which he will use to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and gasoline to ensure proper plant care of his rice crop production. 

Melicio believes that his success relies on his hard work, proper farming techniques, and resourcefulness. He hopes that his loan will be granted, so that he can attain his goals in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and gasoline for his farming business.

loans.name: Bleoo Group

texts.en:
This group is called Bleoo and is made up of three members, all from Teshie. The group consists of two women and one man. They have been together as a group for the past two years, and this is their third loan with ID-Ghana. They meet on Fridays to discuss business and repay their loan, if any payment is due.

Marie is a 40-year-old beef, milk powder and provision seller, married to Samuel, a 42-year-old mechanic. They have three children. The two eldest are twins, and all three are in school.  Marie needs a loan of 700 Ghanaian cedis, to buy beef and frozen meat to resell to her customers. She will use the profit to help her husband to take good care of their children’s education. She has been in her business for the past three-and-one-half years and has finished repaying her prior loan of 700 Ghanaian cedis.

The group requests to borrow an amount totaling 1,700 Ghanaian cedis to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy beef , provison and frozen meat to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finance his higher education.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor José Alfredo  tiene su negocio de abarroterías en el mercado de Chinandega es viudo y labora de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro y media de la tarde.

En cuanto al crédito el señor  lo necesita para la comprar mercancía para su negocio, como la vainilla, frambuesas, arroz y trigo.

por caja ya que ese producto es el que más vende.

El señor ha incrementado su inventario con los financiamientos que ha obtenido, es un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Jose Alfredo has his grocery store business in the Chinandega market.  He is a widower and works Monday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon.

The loan he needs is to buy boxes of raspberries and vanilla, rice and wheat, since these are the products he sells most.  This borrower has increased his inventory with the financing that was offered to him.  He is an excellent customer.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business, like vanilla, raspberries, rice, and wheat.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos, dos quais 1 já frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É chefe de secção na empresa de produção e venda de Banana e com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja regressar a Escola e continuar com os estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir harmonizar o horário de trabalho com a Escola para continuar com a sua formação académica.
texts.en:
He's married and the father of two children, one of whom is already in school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's head of department at a company that produces and sells bananas. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.) in order to enlarge his house.
In the future he wishes to go back to school and complete his studies. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is reconciling his work and school schedules so that he can move forward with his education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.) in order to enlarge his house.

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr:
Mme RACHIDATOU  est célibataire sans enfant.
Elle est étudiante  en classe de 2è année  Technicien Supérieur (TS) à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mme veut financer ses études supérieures.
  Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après la fin du cycle de technicien supérieur, elle aimerait travailler afin de pouvoir rembourser le prêt in challah.
texts.en:
Rachidatou is single, with no children. 

For the past two years, she has been enrolled at the ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), where she is pursuing an advanced technician's degree and currently doing second-year coursework. She is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in our country.

Rachidatou wants to finance her higher education studies.

During school breaks, she does practical internships, in order to gain professional experience. Once she completes her advanced technician's degree, she plans to find employment in order to pay back her loan, God willing.

loans.use: to finance her higher education studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products (fish, charcoal, firewood, rice, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
La señora tiene su negocio ubicado en  uno de los parques de Chinandega lugar que es bastante visitado, es por tal razón que Maritza Isabel se presento a ceprodel para solicitar  un financiamiento para surtir su negocio y no dejar de venderles productos a sus clientes.

La señora se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia de ella dependen dos hijos que están en la universidad, trabaja de lunes a domingo, uno de sus sueños es ver a todos sus hijos con su carrera finalizada. Poco a poco ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower has her business located in one of the parks in Chinandega, a place that is well visited.  This is the reason she came to our office for a loan to supply her business, to not have to stop selling products to her customers.

She works hard to get her family ahead.  She has two dependent children who are in the university.  She works from Monday through Sunday.  One of her dreams is to see all her children finish their education.  Little by little she has improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as a variety of candy

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr ADAMA est célibataire sans enfant.
Il  est étudiant  en classe de TS (Technicien Supérieur) II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
 Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après ses  études du cycle des techniciens supérieurs, il compte travailler et rembourser le prêt avant de viser d’autres objectifs.
texts.en:
Adama is single, and he has no children. For the past two years, he has been enrolled at the ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), where he is pursuing an advanced technician's degree.  He is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in our country. 

Adama wants to finance his higher education studies.

During school breaks, he does practical internships, in order to gain professional experience. Once he completes his advanced technician's degree, he plans to find employment, pay back his loan, and then work towards other goals.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: Beautiful Flowers Group

texts.en:
This group of friends and neighbors live in the district of 'kpeshie' in the greater Accra region of Ghana. This group is made up of 14 people who are searching continuously for opportunities to make a headway in business, and to bring a better future to their children through their daily efforts. The primary business activities of the members are, for example: food sales, sales of crafts, a grocery store, fuel sales, drinks, fish, meat, fruit, sandals, materials, and much more.

Mabel is a member of the group and her primary economic success has been in the sales of sandals and fruits like pineapple, pawpaw (papaya), grapes, and bananas. She runs a shop where she sells sandals and fruits, from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., at her residence. She buys items from the market and supplies part to her punctual customers and sells part to the nearby customers. It has been 10 years since she began this business, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work and the support she received from ID-Ghana through Kiva. At this time, Mabel is in need of a loan of 1,000 Ghana cedis (GHS) to buy enough fruits and sandals to supply to customers. With Christmas approaching, customers are demanding for childrens' sandals for the celebration.

The members as a whole are thankful for the opportunity that has been offered and promise to make payments of each of their different loans on schedule as arranged. The group needs a total amount of 9,800 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sandals to supply to customers.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito grows rice crops on his two hectares of farm land. He is 52 years old, married and has three children.  One of his children is married. His second child is an overseas Filipino worker and his youngest is still studying.

Benito's wife is a city aid in Santiago. According to Benito, he started cultivating his farm in 1980. For long periods of time, devoted by Benito in his rice field, he has been able to sustain his family's basic needs, send his three children to school and improve their financial stability. Benito is now happy to see that the fruit of his sacrifices and perseverance improves their lives.  He and his wife are not yet satisfied with their business career so he is asking for additional capital amounting to 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). This loan amount will be used to buy fertilizer and some of the amount will be used to pay for land preparation of his rice field. Benito hopes to obtain his requested loan amount in order to have a viable source of income and allow his youngest child to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation of his rice field

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктамджон женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей, также продажей молока. Уктамджон занимается животноводством, откармливает скот у себя дома.    Также он работает инженером строителем. Так как его заработной платы не хватает на жизнь он вынужден заниматься животноводством.    Уктамджон дома имеет несколько голов скота и дойную корову, которая каждый день дает 10 литров молока.    Его жена продает соседям молоко.   От откармливания скота они получают нормальную прибыл, поэтому они стараются развивать свой бизнес. На фотографии он со своим сыновьями.    Уктамджон хочет приобрести скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку !!!
texts.en: Uktam is married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker who looks after their children, and she also sells milk.  Uktam is involved in cattle breeding, and he raises cattle on his own farm.  He also works as a building engineer, but since his salary from that job is not enough to live on, he raises cattle.  Uktam has a few head of cattle on his farm, as well as a dairy cow which gives ten liters of milk a day.  His wife sells milk to the neighbors.  Uktam receives a good price for his fattened cattle, so he is trying to expand his business.  His sons are pictured in the photo with him.  Uktam wants to buy livestock and increase his head of cattle.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their help and support!

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nohemy Yolanda

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y con el servicio de transportes por lo tanto tiene un carro con el cual hace el servicio turístico llevando a turistas a diferentes lugares de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia quiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del vehículo va comprar llantas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still in the communal bank "Señor de Muruhuay". She also still runs a taxi service. For this reason she has a car, which she uses to transport tourists to different parts of Cusco city. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of maintaining the vehicle. She will buy new tyres. She would be very happy to receive this loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the vehicle and purchase brakes

loans.name: Inobathon

texts.ru: Инобат пришла в МДО Арванд , что бы получить кредит для покупки скота и корма для скота.   Она занимается откормом и куплей продажей коз и овец.  Из-за нехватки корма она вынуждена была продать нескольких  скотов.   Теперь ей нужны деньги, чтобы  купить коз и корм для скота.   Зимой она будет откармливать скот, чтобы весной смогла продать подороже.   Ее сыновья работают в Российской Федерации, но они присылают деньги своим женам и детям  на проживание, поэтому ей больше некуда обращаться за финансовой поддержкой.   Она будет очень благодарна, получить  кредит для приобретения скота и корма. Заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Inobathon came to MDO Arvand to ask for a loan to buy animals and feed for her herd.  She buys, raises and sells sheep and goats.  Because of her feed shortage, she needed to sell off a few of her animals.  Now she needs money to buy goats and feed for her animals.  She will fatten up her herd over the winter to sell them off at a profit in the spring.  Her sons work in the Russian Federation, but they send money to their wives and children for living expenses.  Because of this, she has nowhere else to turn for financial support.  She will be very grateful to receive this loan to buy animals and feed.  She sends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор родился в 1977  в сельской местности.  Не женат, проживает с родителями.  Абдукахор не имеет высшего образования. Занимается купле-продажей сухофруктов(курагу)  на рынке.   Сухофрукты закупает и привозит с соседнего города. Этой деятельностью он занимается более 7 лет.  Кроме этой деятельностью  он занимается строительными работами. Но основной доход от сухофруктов.   Абдукахор берет  кредит для расширения своего бизнеса, хочет закупить несколько мешков сухофруктов так как зимой это очень выгодно.  По словам клиента , он очень благодарен такой организации как ООО МДО "Арванд" и желает дальнейшего сотрудничества.
texts.en: Abdukahor was born in a rural area in 1977.  He is not married and he lives with his parents.  Abdukahor has not received a higher eduction.  His business is buying and selling dried fruits (apricots) in the market.  He buys dried fruits and transports them to another town.  He has been in this line of work for more than seven years.  Aside from this, he also works in construction, but his main income is from the dried fruits.  Abdukahor is asking for a loan to expand his business; he wants to buy a few bags of dried fruits as they will be very useful over the winter.  In the words of this client, he is very grateful for organizations like MDO Arvand and he hopes for further cooperation with them.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits

loans.name: Caodat

texts.ru: Саодат в возрасте 23 лет,замужем ,имеет сына.   Саодат умная,пунктуальная и успешная женщина, знаток своего дела.Не смотря на молодость,она трудолюбивая и ответственная .    Саодат очень любит детей ,поэтому она начала заниматься продажей детской одежды.     С 2010 года она начала кредитоваться в нашей  организации и достигла больших успехов.    Год за годом ее товарооборот увеличивается, а Саодат старается войти в доверия каждого клиента, и поэтому у нее много постоянных клиентов.     А ее муж занимается купле продажей скота и помогает ей по бизнесу.    Успешно погасив свой предыдущий кредит Саодат решила получить очередной.  На полученный кредит она хочет привести зимний  товар и расширить свой ассортимент товаров.    Саодат благодарна всем кто помог ей в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Caodat is 23 years old and is married with a son.  Caodat is a smart, punctual and successful woman who is an expert at her business.  Not taking her age into account, she is hard-working and responsible.  Caodat loves children very much, which is why she started a business selling children's clothing.  She has been a borrower with our organization since 2010 and has had great successes.  Her turnover increases year after year as Caodat tries to build a trusting relationship with every client, which is why she has many regular clients.  Her husband buys and sells livestock and helps her with her business.  Having successfully satisfied her previous loan, Caodat has decided to apply for another.  On receiving her loan, she wants to buy winter goods and expand her assortment of goods.  Caodat thanks everyone who helped her in difficult times.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina  ella es conviviente  tiene 30 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares y otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como perfumes de varones para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, venta de cuadros, venta de productos de belleza, tienda de abarrotes, pastelería, ferretería.

Las personas que sale en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Patron de San Jeronimo.”  This bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Dina lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling beauty products like creams, perfumes and colognes, among other things.  She works independently selling her merchandise to customers that ask for her like friends, relatives and others.  She has a good time in this business which is going well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts into it every day.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and being this way she moves her family forward.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise like men’s colognes for her business.

The other members are engaged in businesses such as the sale of handicrafts, the sale of paintings, the sale of beauty products, a grocery store, a bakery and hardware store.

The people who appear in the attached photo are members who asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

Dina is grateful to those who are part of this dream by means of this method and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established period of time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as men’s colognes for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Doña Aida ahora ya es jubilada de su trabajo que desempeñaba como profesora de primaria, su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su casa para dejarle a sus hijos un buen hogar y que sus nietos se sientan orgullosos de su abuela, ella recibe apoyo económico de uno de sus hijos, su plan a futuro es poner un pequeño establecimiento de venta de cosméticos para vivir de esos ingresos y complementarlos con su pensión porque a veces el dinero no le alcanza para cubrir los diferentes gastos ya sean médicos, de alimentación o consumos básicos, con este octavo crédito levantara el muro de la parte trasera de su casa para eso necesita comprar bloques, hierro, piedra cantera, cemento, estribo, piedrín y pagar la mano de obra, para poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en: Doña Aida is now retired from her work as a primary school teacher. Her greatest desire is to finish building her house in order to leave her children a good home and make her grandchildren feel proud of their grandmother. She receives economic support from one of her children. Her plan for the future is to set up a little sales establishment for cosmetics, so that she can live on this income and complement it with her pension, because at times the money does not go far enough to cover the various expenses for medicine, food, and basic needs. With this eighth loan she will put up a wall on the back part of her house. To do this she needs to buy blocks, iron, paving stone, cement, brackets, and gravel and pay for labor so that she can have better conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, paving stone, cement, brackets, and gravel and pay for labor

loans.name: Hamro

texts.ru: Хамро хочет получить кредит для покупки корма для  скота.  Его скот находится далеко в горах на пастбищах у пастуха. Сам он не в состоянии содержать скот дома   из-за нехватки корма и травы.  Для этого он обратился в Арванд чтобы  получить кредит и купить корм для скота и пригнать обратно скот в свой дом.  Его жена также помогает в развитии бизнеса. Она получает пряжу, и после обработки продает на рынке. В их кишлаке это основная работа и источник дохода. Чтобы  как то прокормить свою семью, он должен сохранить свой скот до весны. Хамро всячески надеется на поддержку от Арванд.
texts.en: Hamro would like to take out a loan for the purchase of livestock feed.  His herd far up in the mountains, out to pasture with a shepherd.  He himself isn't able to keep his livestock at home because of a lack of feed and grass.  For this reason, he has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy feed so the livestock can be driven back to his home.  His wife also helps with the development of the business.   She uses the wool to make yarn, which she sells at the market.  In their village, this is the main work and source of income.  In order to somehow feed his family, Hamro must keep his livestock until Spring.  He is greatly relying on support from Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Dora tiene 50 años de edad. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al oficio de la panificación artesanal, lo aprendió de sus padres y antes se dedicaba a realizar las labores agrícolas. Ella viaja  a la ciudad cada fin de semana que esta ubicada a 35 kilómetros de su hogar, para ir a comprar los insumos para elaborar el pan durante la semana. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maya y cercar su propiedad, debido a que se dedica también a la crianza de gallinas y con la maya no se le escaparan de su terreno y estará más segura. Su propósito, es continuar con la crianza de aves y la elaboración de pan para obtener un ingreso extra y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 50 years old and has been doing artesian baking for 30 years.  She learned from her parents and used to do farm work.  She travels to the city, located 35 kilometers away, every weekend to buy her weekly baking supplies. 

She will use the loan she is requesting through “Fundación Campo” to buy chicken wire and fence in her property because she also raises chickens and they will not escape through the chicken wire.  She wants to continue raising chickens and baking bread in order to increase her income and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos. Ella se dedica a cuidar un anciano en silla de ruedas, por lo que recibe un ingreso económico de parte de los familiares del señor.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar lámina, para mejorar su vivienda. Actualmente, ella esta alquilando; pero posee un terreno en donde esta construyendo una pequeña vivienda. Con la inversión ella dejara de alquilar y se dedicara a incorporar a su vivienda las condiciones para que este segura. Ella desea dejarles a sus hijos un legado y un lugar seguro donde puedan desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old and is the mother of three children.  She provides care for a senior citizen in a wheelchair, for which she receives an income from his family.

She will use the money from the loan she is requesting through “Fundación Campo” to buy metal to make improvements to her home.  She is currently renting but owns a piece of land where she is already building a small house.  This investment will allow her to stop renting and make her home secure.  She wants to provide a secure place for her children to grow up in.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa tiene la edad de 53 años, es casada su esposo ahora trabaja en albañilería y con esa pequeña entrada ayuda en los gastos del hogar todos sus hijos son casados e independientes, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y variedades en uno de los mercados de Managua desde hace 11 años, sus créditos los utiliza para el capital de su negocio invirtiendo en ropa nueva y este doceavo crédito lo utilizara para el mismo fin de comprar variedad de ropa para hombres mujeres y niños como lo son camisas, pantalones, blusas, entre otros artículos para así complementar los ingresos con el de su esposo para poder cubrir con los diferentes gastos del hogar y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 53-year-old married woman.  Her husband works as a bricklayer, and with his modest income he helps with the household expenses.  All of their children are now independent and married.

For the past 11 years, Nicolasa has had a business selling new clothing and other items in one of the markets in Managua.  She uses her loans for working capital to invest in new clothing, and she will use this twelfth loan for the same purpose, buying a variety of clothing for men, women and children.  This will include shirts, pants, blouses and other items so that she can increase her income and help her husband to cover all the household expenses and continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy shirts and pants for men, women and children.

loans.name: Xiomora De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Xiomara tiene 44 años de edad tienen a su pareja de vida quien trabaja como taxista, tiene 4 hijos el mayor de 23 años ya trabaja pero los otros tres están estudiando, doña Xiomara labora en un auto lavado atendiendo a los clientes hace tres años, esto para generar más ingresos por que con la pulpería no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, colegio de los niños y vestimenta, con ayuda de sus hijos y su compañero ha podido pagar las cuotas de sus préstamos que ha solicitado para realizar mejoras en su hogar, en esta ocasión necesita este onceavo crédito para cambiar el techo y poner el piso de su vivienda, para eso requiere comprar perlines, laminas de zinc, cerámica, piedrines, arena, cemento, para vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, lo cual es necesario.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 44 years old and lives with her life partner who works as a taxi driver.  She has four children,  The oldest one is 23 years old and is working, but the others are still in school.  

For the last three years she has worked at a car wash in order to generate more income, since the earnings from her grocery store are not sufficient to cover the expenses of food, school fees and clothing.  With the help of her children and her partner she has been able to repay the loans she has taken in order to make improvements to her home.  

On this occasion, she needs her eleventh loan so that she can replace her roof and install a floor in her home.  In order to do this, she needs to buy wooden beams, corrugated sheet metal, stone, concrete, sand and tile.  This will allow her to make the necessary improvements to her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, corrugated sheet metal, stone, concrete, sand and tile so that she can lay a tile floor and replace her roof.

loans.name: Guamboteñas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Guamboteñas es un banco comunal que está iniciando con los créditos en la Fundación Espoir, sus 8 integrantes son oriundas de la provincia del Chimborazo pero viven en la ciudad de Cuenca desde hace algunos años, todos se dedican al comercio de hortalizas y viven por los alrededores, a pesar que viven en otra ciudad no cambian su cultura, tradiciones y formas de vestir. Todas son personas amables, gentiles y muy trabajadores, luchan día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Hermelinda, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 9 años. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de legumbres, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. María Hermelinda desde hace 7 años tiene su propio negocio que es el comercio de legumbres, estos productos los vende recorriendo por un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de legumbres para incrementar sus productos.

Su meta es tener su propio local en un mercado de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Guamboteñas is a community bank that is starting with loans from Fundación Espoir.  It’s 8 members are natives of the province of Chimborazo, but they have lived in the city of Cuenca for a few years.  All of them earn a living in the vegetable trade and they live in the outskirts. Despite living in another city, they haven’t changed their culture, traditions and way of dressing.  All are nice, kind, and hard-working people.  They fight day to day to improve the financial situation of their homes and to move forward with their families.  

One of the members of this group is Maria Hermelinda.  She lives in the Feria Libre neighborhood of the city of Cuenca.  She is 28 years old, married and she has a nine year old son.  Her husband earns a living selling vegetables.  They do not have their own house so they rent.  

Maria Hermelinda has had her own business selling vegetables for seven years.  She sells these products as she moves through a market in the city.  She works Sunday to Sunday from four in the morning until three in the afternoon. 

This loan is going to be invested in the purchase of vegetables to increase her products.  

Her goal is to have her own shop in the city market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: La señora Liduvina tiene 25 años, es una persona joven  muy humilde, tienen 1 hija de 5 años que depende de ella, la cual se encuentra cursando el kínder. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y variedades de hortalizas en un pequeño puesto en el mercado central de Monteagudo. Atiende a una clientela variada, su horario de trabajo comienza desde las 5:30 AM. Y termina alrededor de las 8:30 PM. El diario vivir de Liduvina es muy agotador, ella lucha día a día para llegar a tener un futuro mejor. Liduvina quiere tener mas clientela de la ciudad de Monteagudo por ello necesita un poco de dinero para comprar hortalizas y abarrotes y poder venderlos en su pequeño puesto de venta y así poder tener mayores ingresos, que es lo que mas necesita para mejorar la condición de vida de ella y su hija.
texts.en: Liduvina is 25 years old. She is a young person of low income. She has 1 daughter who is 5 years old and who is dependent on her. Her daughter is in kindergarten. She sells greens and a variety of vegetables from a small stall in the central market in Monteagudo. She has a variety of customers and her work day starts at 5:30 AM. She finishes work at 8:30 PM. Liduvina’s daily routine is very tiring. She works hard every day so that she can have a better future. Liduvina wants to have more customers from the city of Monteagudo, but she needs a little money to buy vegetables and grocery items so she can sell them from her small stall, so that she can have better earnings. This is what she most needs in order to improve living conditions for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to diversify her selection

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca que la llaman Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene una arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y siempre mantienen una sonrisa a pesar de las adversidades.

Doña Martha tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es joyero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y el tiempo libre le ayuda a su esposo en su taller, en donde realizan todo tipo de joyas como son anillos, cadenas y aretes en oro, plata y bronce o a gusto del cliente.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de oro y plata para su negocio.
 
Sus metas son crecer en su taller, tener una casa propia y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Martha is one of the founding members of the communal bank, Medio Ejido. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca which they call Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos. It has both colonial and modern architecture and its people still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns. They are friendly, peaceful and they always keep smiling in spite of adversity.

Martha is 31 years old. She lives in a common law marriage and they have 4 children who are 14, 12, 9 and 5 years old. Her first two children are studying in high school and her last two children are studying in a little neighborhood school. Her husband is a jeweler. They don't have their own home and because of this they live in a rental unit.

She works on the upkeep of her home and in her free time she helps her husband in his workshop where they make all types of jewelry like rings, chains and earrings in gold, silver and bronze, or according to the preference of their client.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of gold and silver for their business. 

Her goals are to grow their business, to have their own home, and to provide their children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver.

loans.name: Sara Susana

texts.es:
La Señora Sra. Sara se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca que la llaman Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene una arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y siempre mantienen una sonrisa a pesar de las adversidades.

La Señora Sara tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Sara se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías las mismas que aprendió en un curso, realiza carteras, pulseras, aretes, etc. a los que los vende recorriendo la ciudad, ha esta actividad se dedica hace 3 años.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perlas, mullos, cuero sintético y otros materiales para realizar sus carteras.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sara is participating in her third loan from the communal bank, Medio Ejido. She lives in the city of Cuenca which they call Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos. It has both colonial and modern architecture and its people still maintain their culture and traditions from their towns. They are friendly, peaceful and they always keep smiling in spite of adversity.

Sara is 33 years old, she is married and the fruit of this union is 3 children who are 14, 10 and 6 years old. Her first child studies in high school and her other children study in a small school in the city. Her husband works as a mason. The house that they live in is rented. 

Sara works creating artisanal crafts which she learned how to make in a class. She makes wallets, bracelets, earrings, etc. which she sells throughout the city. She has worked on this activity for three years.

She will invest her new loan in purchase of pearls, beads, synthetic chords and other materials to make her wallets.

Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy pearls, beads, synthetic chord and other materials.

loans.name: Mariuxi Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariuxi está realizando el segundo crédito en el banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el Sector de San Joaquín en Cuenca, este lugar se caracteriza ya que sus tierras son muy fértiles y su gente se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una gran variedad de hortalizas y verduras, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Mariuxi tiene 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en una compañía privada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Mariuxi pasa en casa al cuidando de su hogar y también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las mismas que las vende en un mercado de la ciudad.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de plantas de hortalizas.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is taking out a second loan with the communal bank Medio Ejido. She lives in Cuenca, in the district of San Joaquín. This is a place characterised by very fertile soils, and its people devote themselves to agriculture, growing a large variety of vegetables. The people here are friendly and kind, and they maintain their culture and traditions. 

Mariuxi is 27 years old.  She lives with her common law husband, and has three children who are 8, 6 and 1 years of age. Her two older children go to a small school in the neighbourhood. Her husband is a driver, and he works for a private company. They do not own their own house, and so they live in rented accommodation. 

Mariuxi stays at home looking after the household, and also works in agriculture. She grows vegetables which she sells at a market in town.

The purpose of the loan is to buy vegetable plants.

Her dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: To buy vegetable plants.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Doña Sandra de 55 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pintura, sus hijos todos mayores de edad el menor de 22 años está estudiando su último año de la universidad que con mucho esfuerzo doña Sandra le ha venido pagando con su negocio de venta de joyas, carnes y algunos productos variados que los vende por encargo de esta manera doña Sandra ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos con la ayuda de su esposo, este treceavo crédito lo necesita para continuar realizando mejoras del hogar, en esta ocasión hará la instalación de cielo raso del porche, parte pendiente del proyecto de mejorar su vivienda, para eso requiere comprar materiales como poroplas, sus accesorios, ceramica y la puesta de una parte del piso que desea poner de cerámica, así poco a poco doña Sandra ira avanzando con su propósito de ver concluida la construcción y mejoras de su casa.
texts.en: Doña Sandra is 55 years old. He husband works in a paint factory. Her children are all adults. The youngest is 22 and is studying in his last year at the university, for which, with much effort, Doña Sandra has been paying with her business of selling jewelry, meat, and a variety of other products that she sells on request. In this way, with the help of her husband, Doña Sandra has managed to raise her children. She needs this thirteenth loan to continue making improvements on her house. This time, she will install the ceiling of the porch, the remaining part of the project to improve her home. To do this, she needs to pay for materials such as polystyrene and related supplies, tile, and the laying of one part of the floor which she wants to tile. Thus, little by little, Doña Sandra will advance with her goal of seeing the construction and improvements in her house to conclusion,

loans.use: to buy polystyrene and related supplies, tile, and cement

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maritza de 44 años de edad, siempre desempeñándose en una ferretería como ejecutiva de ventas hace muchos años, siendo madre soltera de dos hijos uno de 16 años y una mujer de 22 logro sacarlos adelante ahora una ya trabaja y con su salario poya a su madre, doña Maritza todos sus créditos los ha invertido en la construcción  de su casa el ultimo lo utilizo en instalación de verjas a las ventanas, pero todavía le falta hacer la pared perimetral del lado oeste para asegurar un poco mas su casa, por lo que este cuarto crédito solicitado es para este fin y necesita para ello comprar cemento, arena, piedrín, piedra cantera, bloques, hierro y puertas de madera para los interiores de esa manera ella esta asegurando a su familia y marcando su terreno para mayor privacidad.
texts.en: Doña Maritza is 44 years old. She has been working in a hardware store as a sales executive for many years. As a single mother, she managed to raise her two children, a son age 16 and a daughter age 22. Now the daughter works and helps her mother with her salary. Doña Maritza has invested all her loans in the construction of her house. She used the last one to install grilles on the windows, but she still has not built the perimeter wall on the west side to give her house a little more security. For this reason, this fourth loan she has applied for is for this goal. To do this she needs to buy cement, sand, gravel, paving stone, blocks, iron, and wood doors for the interiors. In this way she will make her family more secure and surround her property for greater privacy.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, paving stone, blocks, iron, and wood doors for the interiors

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es:
La señora Juana Isidra es comerciante  desde hace 21 años  vende verduras y cajetas de dulce en el mercado  de Chinandega, trabaja con la institución desde hace 8 años, los financiamientos le han ayudado a mantener su negocio surtido y a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, Juana Isisdra  solicita un crédito  por que necesita comprar cajas de tomates, sacos de cebollas, una bolsa de pimientos chiltoma, 100 lbs; de patatas; verduras para su negocio y seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes el producto que mas buscan. 

Es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en donde labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde,  con los financiamientos ha podido mantener el  sustento de su hogar. Sus hijas ya no dependen  de ella pero gracias a estos financiamientos las saco adelante.
texts.en:
This woman has been a merchant for 21 years. She sells vegetables and dulce de leche in the Chinandega market. She has worked with the institution for 8 years. The loans have helped her keep her business stocked and improve her and her family's quality of life. Juana Isidra ias asking for a loan because she needs to buy boxes of tomatoes, bags of onions, a bag of peppers, 100lbs of potatoes, and assorted vegetables for her business to keep offering her customers the products they seek out the most. 

She is an enterprising and hardworking person who works every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon. With the loans, she has been able to support her home. Her daughters don't depend on her any more but thanks to these loans, she was able to get them ahead.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes, sacks of onions, a bag of chiltoma peppers, 100 lbs. of potatoes.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señorsa Mariana es una socia que conforma el banco comunal Medio Ejido hace 3 años, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que la llaman Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene una arquitectura colonial y la moderna, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y siempre mantienen una sonrisa a pesar de las adversidades.

La Señora Mariana tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y ha procreado 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es un profesional en el enderezado de latas de vehículos y tiene un taller propio, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.

Doña Mariana se dedica a cuidar su hogar y a la venta de ropa por catalogo actividad que la desarrolla hace 6 años, vende su productos puerta a puerta ya que tiene una clientela fiel, trabaja sin un horario fijo ya que vende en todo momento que se le presente la ocasión de ofrecer sus productos.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa de oferta para incrementar su mercadería y ofrecer a sus clientes.
 
Su meta es construirse una casa ya que hace poco tiempo compro un terreno.
texts.en:
Mariana is 36 years old, married and has three children, ages 13, 10, and 5.  Her oldest two attend a local school in town.  Her husband has a body shop and does auto body repair work.  They live in a rented home.
 
Mariana cares for the home and sells clothing via catalog.  She’s been doing this for six years, sells door to door, and has steady customers.  She doesn’t have a fixed schedule and sells whenever the opportunity for showing her products presents itself.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing on sale in order to increase her inventory and have more to offer her customers.

Her goal is to build a home of her own.  She recently bought the land.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Hog raising is the primary source of income of Mrs. Virginia. She has been in her business for 4 years and earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per piglet. Virginia is 39 years old now, and she is married to Roger, a father who is engaged in an agricultural business. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with three children. 

Right now, Virginia has only one pig. She wanted to have more hogs to raise, that is why she is asking a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to buy additional pigs, feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pig. She hopes this will make them fit and nourish to provide higher sales at disposing time, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family living.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 48 years old. He is still single. Federico lives in the village of San Francisco with his mother and his adopted child. To make a living, Federico is busy managing his hog-raising business. He has been in this business for 5 years and  earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per piglet.

At this time, Federico wants to have more hogs to raise. In this regard, Federico is asking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
24-year-old Sophy resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district located in the Battambang province of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with one son. To provide a decent life for her family, Sophy has been working tirelessly as a rice farmer on a two-hectare plot of farmland for four years. She earns around 17,000KHR per day and is able to save approximately 12,000KHR after deducting the daily cost of living. This diligent woman has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one loan cycle already. She has succeeded in making her family's life so much better. 

Now she is in need of money to support her rice-growing business. This business provides the main source of income for her family. Sophy is leading a loan group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 2,500,000KHR in total. Sophy, the group leader, will utilize some portion of her loan to support her rice field by buying fertilizer and pesticide. The remaining portion of the loan will be spent on buying piglets to raise in hope of earning addiitonal profit for the family in the future. After receiving her loan portion and using it as she has planned, Sophy believes that she can increase her crop yields as well as the family's income. She is also planning to use the anticipated income to send her beloved son to a good school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Abashatsi Group

texts.fr:
Hazina fait partie du groupe Abashatsi  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et mariée à H Damien, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants  âgés de 5 à 15 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  produits ménagers (assiettes, cuillers,fourchettes,…) depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’assiettes  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  construire sa propre maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Hazina is part of the Abashatsi Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 40-years old and married to H Damien, a shopkeeper. Together, they have three children, ages 5 to 15.  

For three years, she has been in the business of household goods (plates, spoons, forks...).

She is on her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy more plates for resale in order to earn more revenue.  

In the coming years, she would like to build her own home and see her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of plates.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, 37 years old, is a married woman with two school aged children. Her family lives happily in the village of Gappal. Her husband is working as a driver earning PHP 240 for each day while she manages selling pork barbecue and frozen foods in their village. 

She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 that will be used as added capital in her food selling business which has already been in operation two years. She will buy pork meat and frozen goods like tocino, hotdogs and pork sausage to sell. 

At the moment, Perlita's business is able to generate PHP 4,000 each month and it was used in improving her business to increase her sales for the future welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy pork meat and frozen goods like tocino, hotdogs and pork sausage to sell.

loans.name: Rahmatillo

texts.ru: Рахматилло очень добрый и ответственный человек. Он проживает в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района . Рахматилло в возрасте 42 лет.  Он женат и имеет двоих детей, сына и дочку. Они пока учатся в школе.   Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством  и воспитанием детей а в свободные время старается помогать мужу.  Рахматилло с 2000 года занимается купля - продажей мелко рогатого скота и крупно рогатого скота. Это их семейный бизнес. Он держит скот на пастбище, а зимой у себя дома.  Это их единственный доход и поэтому Рахматилло хочет развивать этот бизнес. На полученный кредит хочет купить 2 голов быка и откормив продать за хорошую цену и тем самым улучшить свои условия проживания.  Рахматилло заранее выражает свою благодарность Арванду за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahmatillo is a very decent and responsible man.  He lives in a village in in the J. Rasulov region.  Rahmatillo is 42 years old, married, and has two children, a son and daughter.  They are still in school.  His wife is a homemaker and cares for the children, but in her free time, she tries to help her husband.  Since 2000, Rahmatillo has been trading in large and small cattle.  This is their family business.  He keeps the cattle out to pasture, but in winter he keeps them at home.  This is their only income and, because of this, Rahmatillo wants to develop his business.  

With the loan he receives, he wants to buy two bulls, and once fattened, to sell them for a good price.  By doing this he will improve the family's living conditions.  Rahmatillo would like to express in advance his gratefulness to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Hog-raising in his village has been Alfredo's (aged 32) business for the past 3 years. He is attentive to his business because this is the only way to help his wife to support their four children. As time passes, their expenses for living grow, so he must double his efforts in raising hogs. For this reason, Alfredo is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes to gain more profit in order for him to provide for the growing needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Phea is 33 years old and married. She is blessed with one daughter and one son, both of whom are her responsibility. To support her family, Phea has been farming rice on a two-hectare farmland and growing beans on a three-hectare farmland. She has been involved in this business for ten years, earning about 22,000KHR per day. 

This will be Phea’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan that she obtained and successfully paid back has helped her better support her family. Now Phea is leading a loan group of two female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 800,000KHR in total. 

This hard-working woman will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. After receiving her loan portion and wisely using it, she hopes that she can boost her income and be able to use the anticipated income to send her beloved kids to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 55 years old, married and has three children. From her pig farming business, she is able to earn about P8,000 per head after fattening them up. 

She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain her children in their daily needs. She dreams of lifting her family from poverty. For this reason, she works hard at her hog raising business. To provide for the necessities of her pigs, she has requested a loan in the amount of P13,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that this will make them fit and well-nourished in order to provide higher sales. She hopes to grow her business to secure her family livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli  is 52 years old and still enjoys being a single woman and serving her family. She manages a retail store where she now rolls the amount of PHP 15,000 as capital into the business that has already been operating for a year. She earns a maximum of PHP 6,000 each month in the business and uses this to invest in her farming as well as other business. 

She is requesting the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional revolving capital in retailing to buy sacks of rice, rice bran, feed and some basic goods as added daily offerings in the store. 

Since Arceli is single, she manages to live with her father together with her sister-in-law, brother and nephew, to whom she is extending support when needed.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, rice bran, feed and some basic goods to retail in the store.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Moung Russey district in Battambang province, Cambodia, Ron is a 58-year-old married woman with three children. Ron earns her living by farming rice, a business in which she has been involved for more than 25 years. She earns about 15,000 KHR per day and manages to save around 10,000 KHR after deducting her daily cost of living. 

Ron, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who is also a first-time borrower, to take out a loan in the amount of 600,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. Ron will use her first-time requested loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. This industrious woman would love to dedicate all of the efforts that she has put into her work into moving her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Choert's Group

texts.en:
Choert is 27 years old. She has one dependent daughter. Choert lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items in the local area. She has been in this business for several years, currently earning about 30,000 Cambodia riels (KHR) per day and managing to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Choert’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is with VisionFund this cycle. Now Choert is leading her group of two to seek for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets for raising to earn additional income for the family. She hopes to get a high crop yield so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com eles.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, peixe, arroz, açúcar, óleo, sabão e outros) para diversificar e aumentar a quantidade do seu produto.
No futuro deseja investir ainda mais no seu negócio e melhorar a qualidade de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial para garantir uma vida melhor na sua família.
texts.en:
She's married and has three children who attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's in retail and sells various products. With this loan she intends to purchase goods (flour, fish, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc.) in order to diversify her merchandise and stock up.
In the future she wishes to invest in her business even more and improve her family's living conditions. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so shat she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is making her business grow in order to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods (flour, fish, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc.) in order to diversify her merchandise and stock up.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is 40 years of age, married and blessed with three school-aged children. Renato lives in the village of San Francisco with his family. He is a farmer who works hard for his family. Aside from the farming business, he also raises hogs for extra income. He has been doing this for two years and usually earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. Renato is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. It will help ensure good nutrition for the hogs and allow him to offer them at a good price which will increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is managing a retail store where she is rolling a PHP 15,000 revolving fund in the business. She also sells food snacks and some raw foods like meat and fish around their village in the afternoon. The business has been operating for 16 years. Raquel is currently earning PHP 10,000 income from the business each month. That was used to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

She is 50 years old and married with three children, who are all now in their adult age. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that will be used in buying groceries like canned goods, soda, etc., and also pigs to raise in her existing pigpen. She will also buy hog feed for her livestock raising maintenance. 

Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Raquel hopes that somehow her managed businesses will grow towards sustainability.

loans.use: to buy groceries like canned goods, soda, etc., and also pigs to raise in her pigpen.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $4 each day. 

Phea is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase fertilizer and a water pump to use for farming. This purchase will help her crops to grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and send her children to a good school. Moreover, Phea hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and a water pump to use for farming

loans.name: Dique

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade para frequentar Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante produz e vende blocos. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar cimento para a produção e venda de blocos.
No futuro deseja aumentar o nível de oferta do seu bloco e melhorar a qualidade, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é empreender mais esforços no controlo de qualidade dos blocos de modo a conquistar mais clientes.
texts.en:
He's married and has a son who's still too young to go to school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a trader who makes and sells bricks. With this loan he intends to purchase cement for making and selling bricks.
In the future he wishes to increase his production level and improve the quality of his bricks. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so that he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working harder on the quality control of his bricks in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cement for making and selling bricks.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos que frequentam Escola ao nível médio e primário, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
É polícia de protecção e quadro do Ministério do Interior. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, pregos, pedra, areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para ampliar a sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é liquidar mais rápido o empréstimo para poder pedir outro muito urgentemente
texts.en:
He's married and has five children who attend elementary and middle school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports a nephew who lives with him.
He's a police officer and a staffer of the Ministry of the Interior. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (beams, nails, sand, cement, iron, etc.) in order to enlarge his house.
In the future he wishes to finish building his house and to acquire a vehicle for personal transportation. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so that he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is repaying the loan as quickly as possible so he can apply for another one very soon.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (beams, nails, sand, cement, iron, etc.) in order to enlarge his house.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 32 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) sells candy, which is made of sugar with peanuts inside. He earns about $5 per day. 

Thon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more materials to produce more candies to sell. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to produce more candies to sell.

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia, aged 56, is a patient mother to her four children who are now adults. Her husband is the one who manages their one-hectare vegetable farm production. They live in Marabulig 1, a peaceful place near the city proper where they sell the vegetables they produce. 

Melencia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as added capital for her separate businesses, a general store and raising pigs. Using this amount, she will buy groceries like soft drinks, seasonings, coffee, sugar, etc. and also pig feed for her piggery business.

Melencia has been operating these businesses for 18 years and through this, she is able to support her children's education. Now, her earned income from her current enterprises is being used to sustain their daily living and she saves any excess amounts for future use.

loans.use: to buy groceries like soft drinks, seasonings, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell and also pig feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Farming has been the business involvement of Lorenzo. It's been two years since he started to cultivate his farmland. Lorenzo is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Lorenzo's main goal is to gain a plentiful harvest this next crop season.
